I like to use the chart above from Syncracy Capital (smart folks) to highlight the consensus view today.
It suggests that decentralized AI is nearing or at the peak of inflated expectations. Crypto AI has had a strong year, with several protocols now at multibillion-dollar valuations.
But I disagree with this view. We’re probably nowhere near the peak for Crypto AI yet.

The consensus view underestimates the sheer scale of the opportunity ahead. We haven’t even hit mania territory. Ask around—how many people really understand Bittensor, the bellwether for Crypto AI? In fact, I believe it could be another 1–2 years before we see a true peak.
Here’s why:
1. Crypto AI tokens ($30B) represent just 2.9% of the total altcoin market cap ($1.04T).
The largest Crypto AI protocols with live tokens—TAO, NEAR, FET, and ICP—sit in the $5B–$10B market cap range, and there are only four of them.
Excluding these four, and keeping in mind that ICP and NEAR aren’t exclusively Crypto AI tokens, the total market cap of Crypto AI stands at just $11.7B. That’s <25% of the market cap of memecoins.
Only four other Crypto AI projects (RENDER, GRT, AKT, AIOZ) are valued between $500M and $5B, with the majority having a market cap under $100 - 200M.

This is minuscule when you consider the massive potential of this trend convergence. Crypto AI encompasses both infrastructure and applications, including next-generation smart contract platforms designed for AI.
By comparison, smart contract platforms today have a combined market cap nearing $600B. There are 8 Layer 1 protocols valued over $10B, and another 12 in the $1B–$10B range.
What could the market size for Crypto AI be? It’s such early days and anyone’s guess.

Bloomberg Intelligence estimates the generative AI market will grow at a CAGR of 30%+, reaching $1.3T by 2032. If decentralized AI captures just 10% of that broader AI market, and we apply a speculative premium common in crypto valuations (say 3X), the result is a $390B market in 2032—13X growth from today’s $30B.
Intuitively, I think this is very conservative yet too far out into the future to be useful.

Another way is to consider Crypto AI growing to 10% of the total altcoin market cap in the next 3 years (2027) as AI apps and smart contract platforms launch and gain momentum. If the altcoin market cap hits $2.7T by then (50% growth from its 2021 peak of $1.8T), that would place Crypto AI at $270B—about 9X growth from current levels. That’s $240B in value waiting to be unlocked.

But these numbers are more illustrative than definitive. There are simply too many unknowns. What they do highlight, though, is the scale of the opportunity and provide us with a sanity check when thinking about valuations.
‍2. Top-tier Crypto AI teams are just getting started‍
Many high-calibre teams have been heads down building for 1–2 years and haven’t even launched their products to mainnet yet.
Several have raised 8-figures in VC funding, including Sentient, Sahara, Vana, Story Protocol, Gensyn, Space and Time, Ritual, Nillion...
Over the next 12 months, we’ll witness major mainnet rollouts and token launches—the AO Computer ecosystem, for example, is one to keep an eye on and which I wrote about earlier this year.‍
3. AI is advancing exponentially.
Look at OpenAI’s recent o1 model, which made significant leaps in reasoning capabilities. Scaling laws continue to hold. Crypto AI will closely track broader AI growth.
That said, there’s a lot of noise today. Perhaps more than any other crypto sector. Many startups and protocols will inevitably fail, even if they see some short-term success.
A selective, discretionary approach to identifying winners will likely outperform a broad “spray-and-pray” strategy.
Positive Catalysts Ahead for 2025
I expect several major tailwinds for Crypto AI that will propel the sector and narrative in the coming year.

Traditional Tech VC Funds Entering Crypto AI: While a16z is already in, major players like Sequoia, Lightspeed, and Accel have only dipped their toes lightly into this sector. As they move further along the investment curve towards decentralized AI, they’ll bring both capital and legitimacy to the space.
OpenAI IPO: With OpenAI’s private valuation already at $150B and growing revenue, a potential IPO in 2025 could spark retail mania for AI investments. There are very few opportunities for retail investors to directly capture value from the AI trend outside of NVIDIA and hardware. This pent-up demand could spill over into Crypto AI tokens, which will be easily accessible on platforms like Coinbase.
A More Token-Friendly US Government: If the next U.S. administration post-November 2024 elections takes a friendlier stance towards crypto tokens, it could provide massive tailwinds for the Crypto AI sector, opening up regulatory clarity and encouraging broader adoption
Breakthroughs in AI: The exponential pace of AI development shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. In a recent blog post, Sam Altman outlines how he believes the future for AI is extremely bright. Progress in AI agents and distributed AI training will unlock new use cases and drive further momentum.

Traditional Tech VC Funds Entering Crypto AI: While a16z is already in, major players like Sequoia, Lightspeed, and Accel have only dipped their toes lightly into this sector. As they move further along the investment curve towards decentralized AI, they’ll bring both capital and legitimacy to the space.

OpenAI IPO: With OpenAI’s private valuation already at $150B and growing revenue, a potential IPO in 2025 could spark retail mania for AI investments. There are very few opportunities for retail investors to directly capture value from the AI trend outside of NVIDIA and hardware. This pent-up demand could spill over into Crypto AI tokens, which will be easily accessible on platforms like Coinbase.

A More Token-Friendly US Government: If the next U.S. administration post-November 2024 elections takes a friendlier stance towards crypto tokens, it could provide massive tailwinds for the Crypto AI sector, opening up regulatory clarity and encouraging broader adoption

Breakthroughs in AI: The exponential pace of AI development shows no signs of stopping anytime soon. In a recent blog post, Sam Altman outlines how he believes the future for AI is extremely bright. Progress in AI agents and distributed AI training will unlock new use cases and drive further momentum.
The Bear Case for Crypto AI
While I’m bullish on the massive potential of Crypto AI, I also recognize that nothing is guaranteed. My thesis would shift if these bear case scenarios play out:

Unfriendly Regulatory Regime: A hostile crypto regulatory environment in major markets like the U.S. could stifle innovation, limit funding, and push crypto projects into grey areas. Tokens are central to decentralized networks and heavy restrictions would undercut one of crypto’s key value drivers. This is less likely in a Trump win but could happen if Kamala becomes the US president.
AI Fails to Live Up to the Hype: Despite the current frenzy and billions in investment, there’s a chance AI won’t deliver on its promise. If progress slows or hits roadblocks, we could see the AI bubble deflate. I think this is unlikely, though.
Failure to Find Large Markets and Product-Market Fit (PMF): No matter how innovative, Crypto AI projects must find real business models and solid product-market fit. The sector could stagnate if decentralized AI fails to integrate meaningful commercial use cases. In this scenario, Crypto AI risks becoming more of a niche.
Mediocre Talent Pool: The pool of top machine learning scientists and engineers is limited. If Crypto AI can’t attract enough top talent who believe in the vision of an open, democratised AI future, innovation will slow, and the sector will struggle to keep up.

Unfriendly Regulatory Regime: A hostile crypto regulatory environment in major markets like the U.S. could stifle innovation, limit funding, and push crypto projects into grey areas. Tokens are central to decentralized networks and heavy restrictions would undercut one of crypto’s key value drivers. This is less likely in a Trump win but could happen if Kamala becomes the US president.

AI Fails to Live Up to the Hype: Despite the current frenzy and billions in investment, there’s a chance AI won’t deliver on its promise. If progress slows or hits roadblocks, we could see the AI bubble deflate. I think this is unlikely, though.

Failure to Find Large Markets and Product-Market Fit (PMF): No matter how innovative, Crypto AI projects must find real business models and solid product-market fit. The sector could stagnate if decentralized AI fails to integrate meaningful commercial use cases. In this scenario, Crypto AI risks becoming more of a niche.

Mediocre Talent Pool: The pool of top machine learning scientists and engineers is limited. If Crypto AI can’t attract enough top talent who believe in the vision of an open, democratised AI future, innovation will slow, and the sector will struggle to keep up.
Part I: Closing Thoughts
Unironically, AI might be the best thing that’s ever happened to crypto.
It opens the door to true mainstream adoption and practical use cases—something that’s eluded gaming, NFTs, and social apps.
We’re heading into a decentralized AI future fueled by open, public networks. The savviest founders and forward-thinking investors are already taking notice.

The toughest part about Crypto AI is that you can't just watch the crypto space. Otherwise, you'll have a very narrow, superficial view of what’s coming. You need to stay plugged into machine learning developments, dig into the latest Arxiv papers, and talk to founders who truly believe they’re building the next big thing in AI.
But boy, I've never been so excited.
In Part II, I’ll dive into and map out the key subsectors within Crypto AI. Some of the most critical areas I’ve identified include:

Decentralised Compute: Training, Inference & GPU marketplaces
AI Agents living on-chain
Data networks
Crypto AI consumer apps
Verifiable AI, and more.
Decentralised Compute: Training, Inference & GPU marketplaces
AI Agents living on-chain
Data networks
Crypto AI consumer apps
Verifiable AI, and more.
Cheers,
Teng Yan

This article is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investments.

metadata.title: Our Crypto AI Thesis (Part I): The Massive Lifetime Opportunity

title: How I'm thinking about: Decentralised AI Training
description: Foundation-scale models are no longer the domain of the top AI labs
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
Decentralised AI Training

‍

Picture this: a vast and powerful AI model but not built in tech giants' cold, secretive labs.

Instead, it’s brought to life by millions of everyday people. Gamers, whose GPUs are usually busy rendering epic tournaments in Call of Duty, are now lending their computing power to something even grander—an open-source AI model owned by everyone around the globe.

In this future, foundation-scale models are no longer the domain of the top AI labs only.

Efficiency is King

For now, though, the lion’s share of heavy AI model training remains anchored in centralized data centres.

Companies like OpenAI are scaling up their massive clusters, and they’re not alone. Elon Musk recently announced that xAI is nearing completion of a data centre boasting the equivalent of 200,000 H100 GPUs. It’s aptly named “Colossus”.

Why is AI training still so centralized? It’s all about efficiency. Training large AI models relies on several key techniques:

• Data parallelism: Splitting the dataset across multiple GPUs to perform the same operations in parallel, speeding up the training process.

• Model parallelism: Dividing the model across multiple GPUs to get around memory constraints.

These methods require constant data exchange between GPUs, making interconnect speed critical.

Interconnect speed = rate at which data is transferred between computers in the network

When training runs cost $50M+, every ounce of efficiency matters.

Model FLOPS utilization (MFU)—which measures how effectively a GPU’s maximum capacity is used—typically hovers around 35-40%. MFU was first introduced in Google’s PaLM paper back in 2022.

Source: Google Cloud

‍

Why so low? While GPU performance has skyrocketed, other essential components like networking, memory, and storage have only improved by 5-10x, creating bottlenecks. This leaves GPUs often sitting idle, waiting for data.

With their high-speed interconnects, centralised data centres can transfer data between GPUs far more efficiently, leading to significant cost savings.

Challenges of Decentralised Training

So, one of the main challenges with decentralized AI training is low interconnect speed.

Since GPU clusters aren’t physically in the same location, transferring data between them takes longer, leading to a bottleneck. Training requires GPUs to exchange data and sync at every step.

The farther apart the clusters are geographically, the higher the latency, slowing down the process and raising costs.

There are distributed training methods that allow the training of smaller models in low interconnect speed environments already. Frontier research is extending this to larger models now.

For example, Prime Intellect’s open DiCoLo paper demonstrates a practical approach where islands of GPUs perform 500 “local steps” before sharing and synchronising the results, resulting in up to 500x lower bandwidth requirements. They’ve extended this to work in a 1.1B parameter model.

Introducing OpenDiLoCo, an open-source implementation and scaling of DeepMind’s Distributed Low-Communication (DiLoCo) method, enabling globally distributed AI model training. — Prime Intellect (@PrimeIntellect)
4:55 PM • Jul 11, 2024

Nous Research’s DisTrO offers another promising solution with 1000x reduction in bandwidth requirements in training a 1.2B parameter model.

What if you could use all the computing power in the world to train a shared, open source AI model? Nous Research is proud to release a preliminary report on DisTrO (Distributed Training Over-the-Internet) a family of… x.com/i/web/status/1… — Nous Research (@NousResearch)  5:25 PM • Aug 26, 2024

There is still quite a way to go, but so far, things look promising.

Another challenge is managing a diverse range of GPU hardware, including consumer-grade GPUs with limited memory that are typical in decentralized networks. Techniques like model parallelism (splitting model layers across devices) can help make this feasible.

What Lies Ahead

There are even bigger ideas on the horizon.

Pluralis suggests that decentralized networks could aggregate more GPU compute power than centralized data centres ever could—even the largest data centres are limited by physical space constraints, power, and cooling.

This means the world's most powerful AI models will be trained in a decentralised fashion.

It’s an exciting thought, but I’m not fully sold on this vision just yet. I need to see better evidence that decentralised training of the largest AI models is technically and economically feasible.

There are already specific use cases for decentralised AI training, such as training mid-sized models or certain types of models whose architecture makes decentralised training most suitable.

Why Crypto?

Large global networks of nodes (computers) are essential to realize the vision of decentralized training and inference.

And the best way to build decentralised networks? Crypto, by far.

Once decentralized training becomes practically feasible, tokens will be the key to scaling these networks and rewarding contributors.

Tokens align the interests of participants, uniting them around a shared goal: growing the network and increasing the token’s value. A well-designed token economy creates a powerful incentive structure, helping overcome the early challenges that typically stall growing networks.

Just look at Bitcoin and Ethereum—they’ve already aggregated the largest supply of computing power globally, proving the power of token-driven networks.

I’d love to hear your thoughts—whether you agree or see things differently. Feel free to drop me an email.

Cheers,

Teng Yan

title: Weekly AI Edge #34
description: Arc Forge launches. Story Protocol (and $IP) arrives with a bang
author: Issy,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM

Big money is flooding into AI. Europe just launched the €200B InvestAI program, building on the European AI Champions Initiative.

The AI race is just beginning.

Building on the European AI Champions initiative, I’m glad to announce InvestAI 🇪🇺

We aim to mobilise €200 billion in AI investments in Europe ↓

— Ursula von der Leyen (@vonderleyen)
9:57 AM • Feb 11, 2025

And Sam Altman (OpenAI) is out here talking about the $500 billion Stargate project, and plans to raise $5 trillion in a few years. Crazy? Maybe. But seriously… how do you even price intelligence?

The big question is: how much of that $$$ flows into Crypto AI?

Infrastructure is improving fast. Projects like Story Protocol and Nillion (mainnet soon) are giving agents tools to protect IP and stay private in a decentralized world. But the truly useful applications? Still lagging. We’ve got launchpads and agents dropping left and right, but too often, it’s a flood of “agent slop” with little real utility.

And therein lies the massive opportunity. The gap between infrastructure and real utility is wide open. Founders who focus on building apps and agents that actually solve problems will own the future.

Quick tips for founders pitching for funds: 1. Skip the buzzwords (DEFAI??), and 2. Get straight to why what you’re building is actually awesome and important.

Good luck!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO

Some serious action in the AI coin market this week.

ARC absolutely popped, soaring by 84%, and it’s no surprise with everyone talking about the Arc Forge launchpad (more on that in a sec). Meanwhile, AI16Z and AVA held their own, up 57% and 49% respectively as AI agent tokens make a strong comeback.

But it wasn’t all green candles. NEUR and MOSS took a hit, sliding 37% and 26%, respectively. This is despite NEUR pushing a new update to better look at bundled transactions and snipers.

Zooming out from Crypto AI, AI startups pulled in a record $110 billion in funding in 2024—a 62% jump from the previous year, according to Dealroom. In contrast, the broader tech sector raised $227 billion, down 12% from 2023.

Source: dealroom.co

The recent downtrend in Crypto AI feels a lot like the Solana saga of 2022—remember when everyone wrote it off? Meanwhile, devs kept building, fundamentals kept improving, and the early quitters quietly disappeared. Fast forward, and it became one big “I told you so” for those who stuck it out.

Time will tell.

Arc Forge: Redefining AI Token Launches
Source: cookie.fun

‍

Arc Forge is here, driving a serious uptick in the ARC’s mindshare. In just a week, ARC’s slice of the Crypto AI mindshare jumped from 1.8% to 3.5%. Not bad, right?

Arc Forge is a token launch platform built on Meteora’s Dynamic Liquidity Market Maker (DLMM), integrated with Jupiter routing.

Translation: Deeper liquidity, sniper deterrence, and a boost to the ARC ecosystem. Let’s break it down.

First up, liquidity. Arc Forge is about reducing slippage and volatile price swings. How? Meteora’s "price bins" system. This allows projects to do more with less capital—whether you're a creator or a trader, that’s a win.

The cherry on top? Similar to Virtuals, every trade on Arc Forge goes through ARC, creating real demand and fees that go right back into the ecosystem. That’s how you make a crypto ecosystem work for you.

Source: Arc Twitter

‍

The first project to launch on Arc Forge? AskJimmy, created by Columbia University quants and a hedge fund veteran with experience managing $1B+ AUM. They’re bringing pro-level trading strategies to the table, covering Spot, Perps, and Options across platforms like Hyperliquid and Uniswap.

And for those who want the easy life, AskJimmy Vaults offer fully automated trading—just set it and forget it.

But of course, it hasn’t been all smooth sailing. The token launch hit a bit of a bump, with the team reportedly pulling $700K from the Meteora Pool by removing ASKJ and USDC. And despite Arc Forge claiming to have multiple anti-snipe measures, snipers were still able to get in on the launch. This all may have contributed to a 25% dip in ARC’s price. Ouch.

The Arc and AskJimmy teams are at least owning up to the fact that this launch was far from perfect—and that’s a start. They know improvements need to be made.

GM
Community Update: We are currently digesting everything and looking to establish a detailed report on what happened with the arc-team. 
It's important return to our ethos : we are first in or we are never in. We will stay the first token from the rig complex. 

Sniper… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— AskJimmy (@askjimmy_ai)
9:12 PM • Feb 13, 2025

Here’s hoping teams like ElizaOS take notes and roll out something polished when they drop their launchpads. No one wants a repeat of this mess.

🌴 Story Protocol: Tokenizing Intellectual Property

Story’s public mainnet is officially live, and it’s ready to flip the script on how we think about intellectual property (IP) in the AI age — a $61 trillion global market.

Its Layer 1 blockchain transforms IP into a programmable asset class, enabling permissionless ownership, exchange, and monetization.

Homer, our Public Mainnet, is live.

Welcome to a new era of ꧁IP꧂

Learn more ↴

— Story (꧁IP꧂) (@StoryProtocol)
8:21 AM • Feb 13, 2025

At the heart of it all is the IP token (currently trading at a $1.8B FDV), which plays a critical role in governance, staking, and, of course, gas fees. It’s also got a deflationary burn mechanism. With 58.4% of the token supply going to the ecosystem, community, and incentives, the protocol is gearing up for decentralization and long-term growth—if everything goes according to plan.

IP Finance (IPFi) and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization could be a game-changer for creators—artists, developers, and scientists alike—enabling them to upload IP, set terms, and automatically earn royalties.

The platform’s focus on fair launch principles and sniper-prevention mechanisms ensures a level playing field. Staking rewards are launching simultaneously for all participants, with long lock-up periods for early backers who supported the project at its inception.

To kick things off, Story is launching a 30-day Day 1 Rewards Portal to incentivize early adopters. They’re also making strategic moves, including a collaboration with ElizaOS, which will allow Eliza agents to access and monetize programmable IP on Story’s platform.

Will Story truly transform the IP landscape?

Success is going to come down to one thing—adoption. Convincing creators, developers, and AI companies to embrace an entirely new IP system is no small task. This is a huge shift, and the jury’s still out on whether the market is ready for it.

‍

Project Updates
Dynamic TAO is live! And you will be able to trade subnet tokens on platforms like Backprop Finance and Taostats. Wanna know more? Check last week’s edition for the scoop on dTAO!
TaoFi, the DeFi + AI powerhouse built on Bittensor, just secured strategic funding from the likes of DCG and Pantera. Their mission? To merge decentralized finance with AI, creating products that benefit both agents and humans alike.
Nous Research released DeepHermes-3 Preview, a new model with toggleable reasoning for enhanced accuracy and transparency. It shows strong gains in math and GPQA benchmarks.
OpenGradient announced Neuro Stack, a performant modular, and open-source development stack for building powerful AI-enabled blockchains.
Shell, an AI consumer layer made history with its SHELL TGE through a community-driven IDO on Binance Wallet. 11425% oversubscribed, 145,106 BNB staked (around $97,043,990!) and the funding target hit in 21 seconds. AI is turning up the heat on BNB Chain!
Naptha AI releases its open-source framework for running Multi-Agent systems at scale
Theoriq releases AlphaSwarm, a starter toolkit for building AI-powered trading agents in DeFi which streamlines agent and swarm development.
FLock, a decentralized AI training platform has just launched Moonbase, an all-in-one AI model marketplace. Here, users can train models, create AI agents with standard APIs, and earn rewards when others use their models.
AO Computer’s mainnet is now live.
AI Agents
Cookie Fun, an index & central data layer for AI agents just dropped Act Two of Cookie DAO. Their goal? To give builders and agents easy access to the data they need, all powered by the COOKIE token.
The Virtuals token has officially hit the Solana chain via MeteoraAG's liquidity pool, with cross-chain bridging available between Base and Solana through Stargate. Time to get those transactions flowing across the chains!
Holoworld is expanding its agent launchpad and marketplace to the BNB chain, letting users launch, interact with, and trade multimodal agents. They’re also making these agents upgradeable with utility on BNB.
Meet TracyAI, a brand-new agent on Virtuals, backed by an NBA Champion. Tracy offers pro-level sports commentary and analytics, bringing top-tier insights to the masses.
Aiccelerate DAO released their 2025 roadmap, focusing on four major areas: building an open-source agent framework, helping future builders thrive, boosting AICC token value, and forging partnerships.
AiccelerateDAO is also teaming up with Story Protocol for The Super Agent Hackathon at ETH Denver on February 26th. They’re offering $60K in prizes for innovative AI agent projects, including competitive trading agents.
Vader AI is rolling out its Early Agent Offering (EAO)—a pre-sale launchpad built on Virtuals, giving early backers access to curated AI agent investments with no lockups and escrow protections. The first EAO? AskBillyBets, an autonomous sports betting agent set to launch on Solana.
Web2 AI
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman turned down Elon Musk's jaw-dropping $97.4 billion offer to take control of the company. Altman’s take? Musk was just trying to edge out OpenAI in the AI race, not genuinely back the mission. So, while OpenAI gears up for a potential $300 billion funding round, Musk keeps pushing forward with his own AI firm, xAI.
Anthropic has dropped the Anthropic Economic Index, which tracks the economic impact of AI by analyzing millions of anonymized Claude conversations. This data is gold for anyone looking to understand AI’s growing role in the economy.
Zyphra just launched Zonos, a next-gen TTS model that delivers ultra-high-fidelity voice cloning with precise control over vocal speed, emotion, and tone. The best part? It's open-source under the Apache 2.0 license. You can test it, access the API, and even download the model’s weights and inference code.

This week, we released not just one… but two in-depth essays on startups laying the foundation for the future of decentralised AI — Bagel and Pundi AI.

More to come!

Bagel (I): Monetizing Open Source AI

No More Piracy. Here's how Bagel's ZKLoRA is changing the game

www.chainofthought.xyz/p/bagel-monetizing-open-source-ai

Pundi AI: The "OpenSea" for Data

How Pundi AI is fighting the centralized data monopoly

www.chainofthought.xyz/p/pundi-ai-the-opensea-for-data

🔥 On X..

Research shows that as AIs get smarter they develop their own coherent value systems

Important thread on AI

— Elon Musk (@elonmusk)
6:12 AM • Feb 12, 2025

Luna, the flagship agent of Virtuals, appears on the “When Shift Happens“ podcast.

structured_content.text: GM
Big money is flooding into AI. Europe just launched the €200B InvestAI program, building on the European AI Champions Initiative.
The AI race is just beginning.

Building on the European AI Champions initiative, I’m glad to announce InvestAI 🇪🇺

We aim to mobilise €200 billion in AI investments in Europe ↓

— Ursula von der Leyen (@vonderleyen)
9:57 AM • Feb 11, 2025
And Sam Altman (OpenAI) is out here talking about the $500 billion Stargate project, and plans to raise $5 trillion in a few years. Crazy? Maybe. But seriously… how do you even price intelligence?
The big question is: how much of that $$$ flows into Crypto AI?

Infrastructure is improving fast. Projects like Story Protocol and Nillion (mainnet soon) are giving agents tools to protect IP and stay private in a decentralized world. But the truly useful applications? Still lagging. We’ve got launchpads and agents dropping left and right, but too often, it’s a flood of “agent slop” with little real utility.

And therein lies the massive opportunity. The gap between infrastructure and real utility is wide open. Founders who focus on building apps and agents that actually solve problems will own the future.
Quick tips for founders pitching for funds: 1. Skip the buzzwords (DEFAI??), and 2. Get straight to why what you’re building is actually awesome and important.
Good luck!
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO
The launch of Arc Forge
Story Protocol hits mainnet
Cookie Fun drops Act Two of Cookie DAO
Some serious action in the AI coin market this week.

ARC absolutely popped, soaring by 84%, and it’s no surprise with everyone talking about the Arc Forge launchpad (more on that in a sec). Meanwhile, AI16Z and AVA held their own, up 57% and 49% respectively as AI agent tokens make a strong comeback.
But it wasn’t all green candles. NEUR and MOSS took a hit, sliding 37% and 26%, respectively. This is despite NEUR pushing a new update to better look at bundled transactions and snipers.

Zooming out from Crypto AI, AI startups pulled in a record $110 billion in funding in 2024—a 62% jump from the previous year, according to Dealroom. In contrast, the broader tech sector raised $227 billion, down 12% from 2023.
Source: dealroom.co

The recent downtrend in Crypto AI feels a lot like the Solana saga of 2022—remember when everyone wrote it off? Meanwhile, devs kept building, fundamentals kept improving, and the early quitters quietly disappeared. Fast forward, and it became one big “I told you so” for those who stuck it out.
Time will tell.
Arc Forge: Redefining AI Token Launches
Arc Forge is here, driving a serious uptick in the ARC’s mindshare. In just a week, ARC’s slice of the Crypto AI mindshare jumped from 1.8% to 3.5%. Not bad, right?
Arc Forge is a token launch platform built on Meteora’s Dynamic Liquidity Market Maker (DLMM), integrated with Jupiter routing.
Translation: Deeper liquidity, sniper deterrence, and a boost to the ARC ecosystem. Let’s break it down.

First up, liquidity. Arc Forge is about reducing slippage and volatile price swings. How? Meteora’s "price bins" system. This allows projects to do more with less capital—whether you're a creator or a trader, that’s a win.

The cherry on top? Similar to Virtuals, every trade on Arc Forge goes through ARC, creating real demand and fees that go right back into the ecosystem. That’s how you make a crypto ecosystem work for you.

The first project to launch on Arc Forge? AskJimmy, created by Columbia University quants and a hedge fund veteran with experience managing $1B+ AUM. They’re bringing pro-level trading strategies to the table, covering Spot, Perps, and Options across platforms like Hyperliquid and Uniswap.
And for those who want the easy life, AskJimmy Vaults offer fully automated trading—just set it and forget it.

But of course, it hasn’t been all smooth sailing. The token launch hit a bit of a bump, with the team reportedly pulling $700K from the Meteora Pool by removing ASKJ and USDC. And despite Arc Forge claiming to have multiple anti-snipe measures, snipers were still able to get in on the launch. This all may have contributed to a 25% dip in ARC’s price. Ouch.
The Arc and AskJimmy teams are at least owning up to the fact that this launch was far from perfect—and that’s a start. They know improvements need to be made.

GM
Community Update: We are currently digesting everything and looking to establish a detailed report on what happened with the arc-team. 
It's important return to our ethos : we are first in or we are never in. We will stay the first token from the rig complex. 

Sniper… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— AskJimmy (@askjimmy_ai)
9:12 PM • Feb 13, 2025
Here’s hoping teams like ElizaOS take notes and roll out something polished when they drop their launchpads. No one wants a repeat of this mess.
🌴 Story Protocol: Tokenizing Intellectual Property
Story’s public mainnet is officially live, and it’s ready to flip the script on how we think about intellectual property (IP) in the AI age — a $61 trillion global market.
Its Layer 1 blockchain transforms IP into a programmable asset class, enabling permissionless ownership, exchange, and monetization.

Homer, our Public Mainnet, is live.

Welcome to a new era of ꧁IP꧂

Learn more ↴

— Story (꧁IP꧂) (@StoryProtocol)
8:21 AM • Feb 13, 2025

At the heart of it all is the IP token (currently trading at a $1.8B FDV), which plays a critical role in governance, staking, and, of course, gas fees. It’s also got a deflationary burn mechanism. With 58.4% of the token supply going to the ecosystem, community, and incentives, the protocol is gearing up for decentralization and long-term growth—if everything goes according to plan.

IP Finance (IPFi) and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization could be a game-changer for creators—artists, developers, and scientists alike—enabling them to upload IP, set terms, and automatically earn royalties.

The platform’s focus on fair launch principles and sniper-prevention mechanisms ensures a level playing field. Staking rewards are launching simultaneously for all participants, with long lock-up periods for early backers who supported the project at its inception.

To kick things off, Story is launching a 30-day Day 1 Rewards Portal to incentivize early adopters. They’re also making strategic moves, including a collaboration with ElizaOS, which will allow Eliza agents to access and monetize programmable IP on Story’s platform.
Will Story truly transform the IP landscape?

Success is going to come down to one thing—adoption. Convincing creators, developers, and AI companies to embrace an entirely new IP system is no small task. This is a huge shift, and the jury’s still out on whether the market is ready for it.

Nous Research released DeepHermes-3 Preview, a new model with toggleable reasoning for enhanced accuracy and transparency. It shows strong gains in math and GPQA benchmarks.
OpenGradient announced Neuro Stack, a performant modular, and open-source development stack for building powerful AI-enabled blockchains.
Shell, an AI consumer layer made history with its SHELL TGE through a community-driven IDO on Binance Wallet. 11425% oversubscribed, 145,106 BNB staked (around $97,043,990!) and the funding target hit in 21 seconds. AI is turning up the heat on BNB Chain!

Theoriq releases AlphaSwarm, a starter toolkit for building AI-powered trading agents in DeFi which streamlines agent and swarm development.
FLock, a decentralized AI training platform has just launched Moonbase, an all-in-one AI model marketplace. Here, users can train models, create AI agents with standard APIs, and earn rewards when others use their models.

AI Agents

Cookie Fun, an index & central data layer for AI agents just dropped Act Two of Cookie DAO. Their goal? To give builders and agents easy access to the data they need, all powered by the COOKIE token.

Aiccelerate DAO released their 2025 roadmap, focusing on four major areas: building an open-source agent framework, helping future builders thrive, boosting AICC token value, and forging partnerships.

title: Weekly AI Edge #33
description: Dynamic TAO is coming. Autonolas announces Olas Pearl.
author: Teng Yan,Issy
full_content:
GM!

Not the smoothest start to the month—markets took a nosedive over the weekend, rattled by Trump’s tariff announcement. Global trade got spooked, and the sell-off was brutal. But now, Trump’s giving Mexico and Canada a 30-day grace period to sort things out, so markets are catching their breath… for now.

David Sacks, the AI & Crypto Czar, just laid out U.S. plan for digital asset leadership. Which is… more working groups. It’s a long road ahead, but maybe—just maybe—we’ll finally see some regulatory clarity and stablecoin protections. (Hope is a dangerous thing, but we’ll take it.)

I was honored to appear with @SenatorTimScott@RepFrenchHill@JohnBoozman@CongressmanGT at @BankingGOP to discuss how the Trump administration and Congress will work together to support digital assets as President Trump directed in his week one EO

— David Sacks (@davidsacks47)
8:42 PM • Feb 4, 2025

We can’t help but feel like the AI agent space is getting overcrowded.  Too many projects tackling the same problems: blockchain AI assistants, DeFi trading bots, and no-code agent builders.

We wouldn’t be surprised if attention shifts elsewhere in crypto AI for a bit while the AI agent hype cools off. We’re looking at Bittensor (with the dTAO upgrade next week), decentralised compute, and AI-driven L1s.

But give it a few weeks/months, and we’re sure something fresh will shake things up in agents again.

Meanwhile, regulatory arbitrage is where crypto excels - finding grey areas and getting around policy hurdles. Imagine using a decentralised network of nodes to generate synthetic data for model distillation.

That’s the kind of innovation that keeps us excited for the future.

---

🚨 One quick announcement before we dive in..

AI moves so fast and keeping up is tough. We struggle too. So we’ve just launched a Telegram channel for Cyra, our AI researcher, to share her key insights in a timely way. She filters the most important news, tracks high-signal discussions across communities on a daily basis.

It’s broadcast-only, so no spam—just pure signal. Join us here:

‍https://t.me/cyra_alpha

---

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

ElizaOS GitHub showdown & latest updates
Dynamic TAO anticipation builds
Autonolas unveils three major updates, including an "Agent App Store"

Brutal week in the markets—ETH nuked 25% in a day, crashing below the $3K support.

AI tokens got wrecked, too. FARTCOIN and AI16Z plunged 63% and 57%, so hard that even FARTCOIN maxi Taiki rage-quit his position.

Meanwhile, FXN took the worst hit, tanking 65% despite its recent mainnet launch.

But it wasn’t all doom and gloom. SNAI (Swarmnode) and NEUR managed to defy the bloodbath. SNAI ripped 48%—likely fueled by its acceptance into the NVIDIA Inception Program.

Source: kaito.ai

‍

Overall, AI’s mindshare has collapsed to 32%, down from 70% last month.

Looks like traders are shifting focus to DeFi, with the Berachain launch. Will AI agents carve out a role in the Berachain ecosystem?

Eliza's GitHub Showdown
Source: star-history.com

‍

Eliza just hit a major milestone, catching up to Solana Foundation's GitHub star count in a photo finish. That’s right, Eliza is giving Solana a run for its money, and the numbers don’t lie. Here’s the breakdown:

@elizaOS:

Stars: 14k
Forks: 4.2k
Contributors: 526

@solanalabs:

Stars: 13.8k
Forks: 4.6k
Contributors: 489

But Eliza is not just about GitHub stars. Their recent v0.1.9 release is packed with upgrades: Instagram and XMTP clients, enhanced autonomous agents, and expanded support for NVIDIA, Livepeer, and Amazon Bedrock. Blockchain integrations? They’ve got Birdeye, Solana improvements, OpenZeppelin governance, cross-chain swaps, and new chains like BNB, Cronos, and Mina.

Oh, and over 100 new developers joined the party..

Meanwhile, the DAO is attempting to revamp its tokenomics. This is mission critical, considering how the price of AI16Z has been tanking lately. Instead of letting its $15M-$30M treasury sit idle, it’s deploying those assets into liquidity pools. By pairing tribute tokens with the AI16Z token in one-sided LPs, it aims to create buy pressure and improve liquidity.

And more partnerships? Yes

Alphanomics: Future Eliza agents will integrate with Alphanomics’ On-Chain Super Terminal, giving users real-time data analysis.
TON: A $20K prize pool for developers building the TON Plugin for Eliza.
Ankr: Connect AI agents to Ankr’s global node network for fast, reliable data streams.
Rena AI: improving Eliza’s trading with advanced price prediction and automated execution.

One more thing: the DAO is launching a Crypto Shark Tank with AI judges. Users pitch their ideas, an “AI Writers Room” generates a full episode script in seconds, and projects get exposure, feedback, and funding opportunities. It’s currently built on PlayCanvas, with potential for Unity or Unreal integration in the future.

🌴 The Rise of Dynamic TAO (dTAO)

Bittensor is about to shake things up with the launch of dynamic TAO. With Coinbase adding TAO to their roadmap and the dTAO whitepaper released, the stage is set for something big.

The countdown has begun: a senate vote kicks off the process, and if all goes well by February 9th, dynamic TAO (dTAO) will make its grand debut between February 10th and 14th. It’s going to be a big week.

Bittensor dTAO is dropping in mid-February.

Huge congratulations to @const_reborn and team @opentensor — we @latentholdings are also very proud to play a role in shipping this for everyone. 🤝🔥🌊

— JJ (@JosephJacks_)
5:35 PM • Jan 25, 2025

But what makes dTAO a game-changer? Let’s break it down.

Dynamic TAO (dTAO) is a massive upgrade to the Bittensor network, set to transform how token emissions are distributed.

Right now, a small group of validators manually assess subnets, deciding their value and rewards. But as the network scales, this system is cracking—validators are overloaded, engagement drops, and manipulation risks rise. So high-value subnets might get overlooked while less deserving ones reap the rewards.

dTAO introduces subnet tokens (think Alpha1, Alpha2, Alpha3) and subnet pools powered by Constant Product Automated Market Makers (AMMs). These pools let users stake TAO for subnet tokens and vice versa, with prices determined by market activity.

In other words, the market decides what each subnet is worth.

Source: bittensor.com

‍

The dTAO system has powerful features: AMMs for subnet pools, fresh liquidity injections, TAO staking/unstaking, dynamic emission distribution, and halving schedules.

Each subnet gets its own liquidity pool, allowing true price discovery between subnet tokens.

With dTAO, subnet valuations are no longer dictated by a select few but by the collective intelligence of the market. This upgrade cements Bittensor’s vision: a decentralized network where growth is driven by the community, for the community.

Project Updates
Autonolas has launched Olas Pearl, a desktop "agent app store" that simplifies the deployment and management of autonomous AI agents across DeFi, influencer marketing, and prediction markets. Users can earn OLAS by running agents and staking tokens. Olas recently raised a $13.8M funding round and launched a $1M accelerator program.
Mira Network announces Magnum Opus, a $10M builder grant program to accelerate AI innovation. The program offers retroactive grants, mentorship, technical support, and strategic distribution to empower builders.
Nillion partners with Io.net to enable private AI inference at scale, leveraging a global GPU network while keeping data and model parameters secure.
0G Foundation unveils an $88.88M Ecosystem Growth Program to accelerate AI as a public good on the largest L1 for AI.
Worldcoin introduces Anonymized Multi-Party Computation (AMPC), an open-source, quantum-secure privacy solution designed for the AI era, ensuring robust protection for users and AI agents.
The winners of the Coinbase CDP AI Hackathon were announced, featuring DeFi agents, social media agents, educational agents, and a proof-of-authenticity initiative built on Bittensor.
Gaia Network introduces the Gaia XP Program, rewarding community contributions with Gaia points, which can be redeemed for Gaia credits to interact with Gaia AI Agents, fostering a thriving decentralized AI ecosystem.
Sapiens, a decentralised data foundry for AI, releases its litepaper
AI Agents
Acolyt launches the Signal framework, an open-source system to help AI agents achieve clear goals, like increasing mindshare on X
Warden Protocol introduces the Warden Agent Kit, empowering developers to create on-chain AI agents that trigger smart contracts using AI outputs, combining off-chain processing with on-chain execution for DeFi automation.
Soleng, a Web3 solutions engineering and DevRel agent, is now powered by Hyperbolic’s decentralized compute framework, automating and enhancing developer relations.
Aiccelerate DAO partners with Virtuals as a founding Venture Partner, offering $50K grants to selected projects in exchange for token shares, advancing a multi-ecosystem AI future.
SwarmNode joins the NVIDIA Inception Program, gaining access to new technical tools, resources, and investor networks.
Web2 AI
OpenAI continues to push boundaries with the launch of o3-mini, now integrated into ChatGPT and the API, offering enhanced capabilities for developers and users alike. Meanwhile, their Deep Research feature enables ChatGPT to analyze and compile comprehensive reports from hundreds of sources in minutes—a task that would take humans hours.
Google DeepMind has made Gemini 2.0 Flash generally available, positioning it as the go-to model for high-frequency, high-volume tasks at scale. Its efficiency makes it a powerhouse for developers tackling demanding workloads.
Anthropic introduces Constitutional Classifiers, a breakthrough in AI safety that reduces jailbreaks by 95% while maintaining minimal impact on refusals. Leveraging synthetic data and principle-based rules, it adapts dynamically to emerging threats.
ByteDance, the company behind TikTok, unveils OmniHuman-1, a cutting-edge AI model capable of generating hyper-realistic videos from just a single image and audio track, opening new possibilities in content creation. It’s mindblowing.

Earlier this week, we dropped an essay on Freysa, one of the few AI agent projects that really caught our eye in a noisy space. She’s a new breed of AI agents, known as Sovereign AIs. Read it here 👇

Freysa: The AI That Owns Itself

Can we build Sovereign AI agents worthy of our trust? Here's how

www.chainofthought.co/protocols/freysa-the-ai-that-owns-itself

🔥 On X..

Bittensor is paying $1 billion / year in liquid TAO rewards for open-source AI

Bittensor is paying $1 billion / year in very liquid $TAO rewards for anyone on earth who contributes to designing, shipping and scaling open source AI — on many dimensions.

You don’t need VC. You don’t even need a startup. You certainly don’t need capital.

This figure will… x.com/i/web/status/1…

structured_content.text: GM!

Not the smoothest start to the month—markets took a nosedive over the weekend, rattled by Trump’s tariff announcement. Global trade got spooked, and the sell-off was brutal. But now, Trump’s giving Mexico and Canada a 30-day grace period to sort things out, so markets are catching their breath… for now.

David Sacks, the AI & Crypto Czar, just laid out U.S. plan for digital asset leadership. Which is… more working groups. It’s a long road ahead, but maybe—just maybe—we’ll finally see some regulatory clarity and stablecoin protections. (Hope is a dangerous thing, but we’ll take it.)

I was honored to appear with @SenatorTimScott@RepFrenchHill@JohnBoozman@CongressmanGT at @BankingGOP to discuss how the Trump administration and Congress will work together to support digital assets as President Trump directed in his week one EO

— David Sacks (@davidsacks47)
8:42 PM • Feb 4, 2025
We can’t help but feel like the AI agent space is getting overcrowded.  Too many projects tackling the same problems: blockchain AI assistants, DeFi trading bots, and no-code agent builders.

We wouldn’t be surprised if attention shifts elsewhere in crypto AI for a bit while the AI agent hype cools off. We’re looking at Bittensor (with the dTAO upgrade next week), decentralised compute, and AI-driven L1s.
But give it a few weeks/months, and we’re sure something fresh will shake things up in agents again.

Meanwhile, regulatory arbitrage is where crypto excels - finding grey areas and getting around policy hurdles. Imagine using a decentralised network of nodes to generate synthetic data for model distillation.
That’s the kind of innovation that keeps us excited for the future.
🚨 One quick announcement before we dive in..

AI moves so fast and keeping up is tough. We struggle too. So we’ve just launched a Telegram channel for Cyra, our AI researcher, to share her key insights in a timely way. She filters the most important news, tracks high-signal discussions across communities on a daily basis.
It’s broadcast-only, so no spam—just pure signal. Join us here:
‍https://t.me/cyra_alpha
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

ElizaOS GitHub showdown & latest updates
Dynamic TAO anticipation builds
Autonolas unveils three major updates, including an "Agent App Store"
ElizaOS GitHub showdown & latest updates
Dynamic TAO anticipation builds
Autonolas unveils three major updates, including an "Agent App Store"
Brutal week in the markets—ETH nuked 25% in a day, crashing below the $3K support.
AI tokens got wrecked, too. FARTCOIN and AI16Z plunged 63% and 57%, so hard that even FARTCOIN maxi Taiki rage-quit his position.
Meanwhile, FXN took the worst hit, tanking 65% despite its recent mainnet launch.
But it wasn’t all doom and gloom. SNAI (Swarmnode) and NEUR managed to defy the bloodbath. SNAI ripped 48%—likely fueled by its acceptance into the NVIDIA Inception Program.
Overall, AI’s mindshare has collapsed to 32%, down from 70% last month.
Looks like traders are shifting focus to DeFi, with the Berachain launch. Will AI agents carve out a role in the Berachain ecosystem?
Eliza's GitHub Showdown

Eliza just hit a major milestone, catching up to Solana Foundation's GitHub star count in a photo finish. That’s right, Eliza is giving Solana a run for its money, and the numbers don’t lie. Here’s the breakdown:
@elizaOS:

Stars: 14k
Forks: 4.2k
Contributors: 526
Stars: 14k
Forks: 4.2k
Contributors: 526
@solanalabs:

Stars: 13.8k
Forks: 4.6k
Contributors: 489
Stars: 13.8k
Forks: 4.6k

But Eliza is not just about GitHub stars. Their recent v0.1.9 release is packed with upgrades: Instagram and XMTP clients, enhanced autonomous agents, and expanded support for NVIDIA, Livepeer, and Amazon Bedrock. Blockchain integrations? They’ve got Birdeye, Solana improvements, OpenZeppelin governance, cross-chain swaps, and new chains like BNB, Cronos, and Mina.
Oh, and over 100 new developers joined the party..

Meanwhile, the DAO is attempting to revamp its tokenomics. This is mission critical, considering how the price of AI16Z has been tanking lately. Instead of letting its $15M-$30M treasury sit idle, it’s deploying those assets into liquidity pools. By pairing tribute tokens with the AI16Z token in one-sided LPs, it aims to create buy pressure and improve liquidity.
And more partnerships? Yes

Alphanomics: Future Eliza agents will integrate with Alphanomics’ On-Chain Super Terminal, giving users real-time data analysis.
TON: A $20K prize pool for developers building the TON Plugin for Eliza.
Ankr: Connect AI agents to Ankr’s global node network for fast, reliable data streams.
Rena AI: improving Eliza’s trading with advanced price prediction and automated execution.
Alphanomics: Future Eliza agents will integrate with Alphanomics’ On-Chain Super Terminal, giving users real-time data analysis.
TON: A $20K prize pool for developers building the TON Plugin for Eliza.

Rena AI: improving Eliza’s trading with advanced price prediction and automated execution.

One more thing: the DAO is launching a Crypto Shark Tank with AI judges. Users pitch their ideas, an “AI Writers Room” generates a full episode script in seconds, and projects get exposure, feedback, and funding opportunities. It’s currently built on PlayCanvas, with potential for Unity or Unreal integration in the future.
🌴 The Rise of Dynamic TAO (dTAO)
Bittensor is about to shake things up with the launch of dynamic TAO. With Coinbase adding TAO to their roadmap and the dTAO whitepaper released, the stage is set for something big.

The countdown has begun: a senate vote kicks off the process, and if all goes well by February 9th, dynamic TAO (dTAO) will make its grand debut between February 10th and 14th. It’s going to be a big week.

Bittensor dTAO is dropping in mid-February.

Huge congratulations to @const_reborn and team @opentensor — we @latentholdings are also very proud to play a role in shipping this for everyone. 🤝🔥🌊

— JJ (@JosephJacks_)
5:35 PM • Jan 25, 2025
But what makes dTAO a game-changer? Let’s break it down.
Dynamic TAO (dTAO) is a massive upgrade to the Bittensor network, set to transform how token emissions are distributed.

Right now, a small group of validators manually assess subnets, deciding their value and rewards. But as the network scales, this system is cracking—validators are overloaded, engagement drops, and manipulation risks rise. So high-value subnets might get overlooked while less deserving ones reap the rewards.

dTAO introduces subnet tokens (think Alpha1, Alpha2, Alpha3) and subnet pools powered by Constant Product Automated Market Makers (AMMs). These pools let users stake TAO for subnet tokens and vice versa, with prices determined by market activity.
In other words, the market decides what each subnet is worth.
The dTAO system has powerful features: AMMs for subnet pools, fresh liquidity injections, TAO staking/unstaking, dynamic emission distribution, and halving schedules.
Each subnet gets its own liquidity pool, allowing true price discovery between subnet tokens.

With dTAO, subnet valuations are no longer dictated by a select few but by the collective intelligence of the market. This upgrade cements Bittensor’s vision: a decentralized network where growth is driven by the community, for the community.

title: Weekly AI Edge #32
description: Crypto AI reels from DeepSeek. Nous Research announces Psyche.
author: Teng Yan
full_content:
GM!

Happy Lunar New Year! Wishing you prosperity, good health, and maybe even some green candles.

But while the festivities are in full swing, the markets clearly didn’t get the memo.

The launch of DeepSeek triggered a mass sell-off across US tech equities and AI-related stocks—and the hot takes have been flying.

Most of them? Pretty bad. But one of the more thoughtful takes came from Dario, CEO of Anthropic:

“..DeepSeek V3 is not a unique breakthrough or something that fundamentally changes the economics of LLMs; it’s an expected point on an ongoing cost reduction curve. What’s different this time is that the company that was first to demonstrate the expected cost reductions was Chinese.”

Cheaper, better, faster AI is always a win in our book.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Nous Psyche, the latest from Nous Research
The controversy around VVV
DeepSeek, a huge deflationary shock to the price of intelligence

Another brutal week in the market. The launch of DeepSeek, combined with weak sentiment across sectors, brought even more pain.

Agent-related tokens got wrecked—MOSS, NOVA, and ELIZA all plunged 50% this week alone. Even major AI names like VIRTUAL, FARTCOIN, AI16Z, and AIXBT weren’t spared, each dropping 20-30%. Right now, buying into agents feels like catching a falling knife.

On the flip side, MOR and TAO stood strong. Morpheus kept up last week’s momentum, pumping another 50%, likely fueled by VVV’s launch due to their partnership. Meanwhile, TAO is finally getting some love. With more chatter around the upcoming dTAO upgrade, it looks like everyone is waking up to the fact that TAO has been overlooked for too long.

VVV Airdrop Controversy

Venice dropped its VVV token out of nowhere, and yeah—it made waves.Venice is a chatGPT-like app that runs on open-source models like Deepseek and Llama, but everything stays in your browser with prompts routed through their proxy infrastructure to a set of decentralized GPU providers.Venice went all-in on its community, airdropping half the total supply straight to Venice users and Base token holders (VIRTUAL, AERO, DEGEN, etc.). And the numbers? Wild.

10M out of 25M tokens have already been claimed
124 accounts scored 5,000–10,000 VVV each ($40K–$80K).
287 accounts walked away with 10,000+ VVV (over $80K).

But then came the dump. Since launch on Jan 27, the market cap cratered from $680M to $170M—a brutal 60-70% correction. Coinbase listing VVV within one day didn’t help either.The data tells an interesting story. On Jan 28, there was a 20K jump in holders, likely due to the 24H airdrop unlock rule. Regular Venice users had their tokens locked for 24H and had to upgrade to Pro to claim. Meanwhile, Base ecosystem holders and others with unlocked tokens could sell immediately. When those tokens hit the market, well… you can guess what happened next.

This TGE was messy. Some were thrilled with free money for holding Crypto AI tokens, while Venice users felt rugged by the lock-up period.And it wasn’t just the tokenomics causing a stir. Concerns popped up over Venice sending inference requests in plain text, raising questions about GPU providers seeing user prompts. Then there was the insider trading scandal, with two Aerodrome contributors suspended and Venice team members dumping ~1% of the supply on day one. Not a good look, in our opinion.Airdrop mania, a controversial launch, and privacy concerns. Plenty of drama for a week.

🌴 The Mortal who became a Goddess

Nous Research just dropped Nous Psyche, and it’s a big one.

This new infrastructure aims to decentralize and democratize AI development, making training and inference accessible to the community.

Built on Solana, Phase 1 of Psyche is all about cooperative training for generative AI—pulling together a mix of GPUs, from gaming rigs (4090s) to data centre powerhouses (A100s, H100s), to train AI models at scale. It builds on Nous’ previous work with Nous DisTrO, which trained a 15B parameter model across multiple locations in the U.S. and Europe last year—setting a record for fastest convergence in distributed training, all without high-speed interconnect hardware.

Phase 2 is where things get even more interesting—Psyche moves beyond just training and into reasoning and reinforcement learning. Think Deepseek R1, but trained on a decentralized network that allows for accessible inference and higher-order thinking models‍

Fun fact: The project is named after Psyche from Greek mythology - a mortal who became a goddess through sheer determination. Good omen?

The endgame? Open, decentralized infrastructure for training superintelligence. A pretty wild vision.

Nous hasn’t officially announced a token, but all signs point to it. A well-designed token could coordinate resources, align incentives, and drive adoption—exactly what Psyche needs to scale.

Nous is already crushing it with their Hermes LLM Series. Hermes 3 is the brain behind tons of social agents on X, Telegram, and Discord. And they're not stopping there - the plan is to make it even smarter through Psyche's reinforcement learning system.For months, Crypto AI has been obsessed with AI Agents. But distributed training has always been one of the most exciting use cases for Crypto AI, and Nous Psyche just put it back in the spotlight.

Funding Raises
Pippin Founder Yohei Nakajima launches Agent Fund, a VC fund for AI agent apps, infra, and tools. Led by Yohei, Alex Reibman, and Adam Silverman, it’s open for investors on a rolling basis. Equity fund, not token-based.
Project Updates
Story Protocol announces Emergenceverse, a franchise with a storyline created by David Goyer. David Goyer is the mastermind behind the Dark Knight trilogy and Blade. AI agents and users will build the next major franchise on-chain.
Nillion network hosts the new DeepSeek R1-14B model privately using TEEs inside nilAI. Users can now access DeepSeek while ensuring their interaction is completely private. Nillion Network is building a privacy-focused network for AI.
Hyperbolic partners with Nexus to provide GPUs for powering Nexus's ZK technology. Hyperbolic’s Eliza plugin is also live, allowing Eliza agents to autonomously use Hyperbolic GPUs
Nesa announces a fully encrypted inference API. Equivariant Encryption (EE) is an adaption of Homomorphic encryption that works on various models to provide end to end privacy on data manipulation but with zero latency.
Prime Intellect releases TOPLOC, a locality-sensitive hashing scheme for verifiable inference. It detects modifications to models, prompts, or precision and is robust across various GPU types. Prime Intellect is building the foundation for decentralized, verifiable compute protocols.
Giza crosses 11.5K autonomous transactions through ARMA, its automated on-chain yield optimizer bot. Users can deposit stablecoins for ARMA to find and optimize the best yields across multiple chains.
thirdweb, a full stack Web3 development platform, introduces Nebula for Unity, allowing game devs to build agents that talk to players and interact on-chain
Incentive Programs / Rewards
Privasea AI’s testnet part 2 has arrived. Users can provide processing power for secure AI computations and earn rewards, including token incentives. Privasea is building an encrypted AI network enabled by FHE.
AI Agents
Virtuals is expanding to Solana, introducing a Meteora Pool, a Strategic SOL Reserve, and maintaining the AGENT/VIRTUAL trading pair. The expansion includes a Venture Partner Model with grants, an AI Hackathon, and collaboration with key partners like Jupiter Exchange and LayerZero. Virtuals also offers grants of 42K VIRTUALS tokens for aspiring projects.
Youmio partners with Virtuals to bring agents to life in 3D worlds. Virtual agents can now be brought into 3D worlds powered by Unreal Engine, opening up new possibilities and environments for these agents.
Chromia rolls out EVAL, an agent that evaluates other AI agents. Built on the Chromia engine and Virtuals ecosystem, EVAL scores AI outputs on truth, accuracy, creativity, and engagement. AIXBT received a score of 80/100.
Drift integrates with the Solana Agent Kit, enabling agents to trade perps, borrow/lend assets, and interact with Vaults. Drift is the home of on chain trading on Solana.
0G Labs releases their ERC-7857 standard. This standard is built explicitly for AI agents and enables the representation of AI agents as NFTs. This new standard includes privacy-preserving metadata where AI “intelligence” stays encrypted and secure.
OLAS announced Modius, an advanced DeFAI agent. Modius autonomously manages crypto assets with intelligent rebalancing and lending strategies.
THINK agents drops their whitepaper for their Agent Standard. The THINK Agent Standard creates the foundation for intelligent on-chain agents, making them composable and interoperable.
ai16zdao rebrands as ElizaOS after a request from the VC firm a16z. The $ai16z ticker will remain.
Bittensor

The dTAO upgrade for Bittensor is set to drop in mid-February, so expect a surge in attention.

Mode launches Synth 'subnet' on Bittensor to build decentralized AI that predicts crypto prices (subnet 50).
Crucible Lab’s State of Bittensor 2024 report is out. It’s a great read.

We dropped a new deep dive this week—now shifting gears from AI agents to the infrastructure powering them. Atoma Network is building the most trustable compute network on the planet 👇

Atoma Network: Private & Verifiable AI  Building the most trustable compute network on the planet

🔥

 On X..DeepSeek = Bullish for Crypto AI?

DeepSeek is extremely bullish for crypto x AI. > An open source model with better performance than Open AI's model built at a fraction of the price--and they did it with inferior hardware.> All the major crypto x AI frameworks can easily use open source models or build on top…
x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Mark (@markus9x)

structured_content.text: GM!
Happy Lunar New Year! Wishing you prosperity, good health, and maybe even some green candles.
But while the festivities are in full swing, the markets clearly didn’t get the memo.
The launch of DeepSeek triggered a mass sell-off across US tech equities and AI-related stocks—and the hot takes have been flying.
Most of them? Pretty bad. But one of the more thoughtful takes came from Dario, CEO of Anthropic:

“..DeepSeek V3 is not a unique breakthrough or something that fundamentally changes the economics of LLMs; it’s an expected point on an ongoing cost reduction curve. What’s different this time is that the company that was first to demonstrate the expected cost reductions was Chinese.”
Cheaper, better, faster AI is always a win in our book.
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Nous Psyche, the latest from Nous Research
The controversy around VVV
DeepSeek, a huge deflationary shock to the price of intelligence
Nous Psyche, the latest from Nous Research
The controversy around VVV
DeepSeek, a huge deflationary shock to the price of intelligence
Another brutal week in the market. The launch of DeepSeek, combined with weak sentiment across sectors, brought even more pain.

Agent-related tokens got wrecked—MOSS, NOVA, and ELIZA all plunged 50% this week alone. Even major AI names like VIRTUAL, FARTCOIN, AI16Z, and AIXBT weren’t spared, each dropping 20-30%. Right now, buying into agents feels like catching a falling knife.

On the flip side, MOR and TAO stood strong. Morpheus kept up last week’s momentum, pumping another 50%, likely fueled by VVV’s launch due to their partnership. Meanwhile, TAO is finally getting some love. With more chatter around the upcoming dTAO upgrade, it looks like everyone is waking up to the fact that TAO has been overlooked for too long.
VVV Airdrop Controversy

Venice dropped its VVV token out of nowhere, and yeah—it made waves.Venice is a chatGPT-like app that runs on open-source models like Deepseek and Llama, but everything stays in your browser with prompts routed through their proxy infrastructure to a set of decentralized GPU providers.Venice went all-in on its community, airdropping half the total supply straight to Venice users and Base token holders (VIRTUAL, AERO, DEGEN, etc.). And the numbers? Wild.

10M out of 25M tokens have already been claimed
124 accounts scored 5,000–10,000 VVV each ($40K–$80K).
287 accounts walked away with 10,000+ VVV (over $80K).
10M out of 25M tokens have already been claimed
124 accounts scored 5,000–10,000 VVV each ($40K–$80K).
287 accounts walked away with 10,000+ VVV (over $80K).

But then came the dump. Since launch on Jan 27, the market cap cratered from $680M to $170M—a brutal 60-70% correction. Coinbase listing VVV within one day didn’t help either.The data tells an interesting story. On Jan 28, there was a 20K jump in holders, likely due to the 24H airdrop unlock rule. Regular Venice users had their tokens locked for 24H and had to upgrade to Pro to claim. Meanwhile, Base ecosystem holders and others with unlocked tokens could sell immediately. When those tokens hit the market, well… you can guess what happened next.

This TGE was messy. Some were thrilled with free money for holding Crypto AI tokens, while Venice users felt rugged by the lock-up period.And it wasn’t just the tokenomics causing a stir. Concerns popped up over Venice sending inference requests in plain text, raising questions about GPU providers seeing user prompts. Then there was the insider trading scandal, with two Aerodrome contributors suspended and Venice team members dumping ~1% of the supply on day one. Not a good look, in our opinion.Airdrop mania, a controversial launch, and privacy concerns. Plenty of drama for a week.
🌴 The Mortal who became a Goddess
Nous Research just dropped Nous Psyche, and it’s a big one.
This new infrastructure aims to decentralize and democratize AI development, making training and inference accessible to the community.

Built on Solana, Phase 1 of Psyche is all about cooperative training for generative AI—pulling together a mix of GPUs, from gaming rigs (4090s) to data centre powerhouses (A100s, H100s), to train AI models at scale. It builds on Nous’ previous work with Nous DisTrO, which trained a 15B parameter model across multiple locations in the U.S. and Europe last year—setting a record for fastest convergence in distributed training, all without high-speed interconnect hardware.

Phase 2 is where things get even more interesting—Psyche moves beyond just training and into reasoning and reinforcement learning. Think Deepseek R1, but trained on a decentralized network that allows for accessible inference and higher-order thinking models‍
Fun fact: The project is named after Psyche from Greek mythology - a mortal who became a goddess through sheer determination. Good omen?
The endgame? Open, decentralized infrastructure for training superintelligence. A pretty wild vision.
Nous hasn’t officially announced a token, but all signs point to it. A well-designed token could coordinate resources, align incentives, and drive adoption—exactly what Psyche needs to scale.

Nous is already crushing it with their Hermes LLM Series. Hermes 3 is the brain behind tons of social agents on X, Telegram, and Discord. And they're not stopping there - the plan is to make it even smarter through Psyche's reinforcement learning system.For months, Crypto AI has been obsessed with AI Agents. But distributed training has always been one of the most exciting use cases for Crypto AI, and Nous Psyche just put it back in the spotlight.
Funding Raises

Pippin Founder Yohei Nakajima launches Agent Fund, a VC fund for AI agent apps, infra, and tools. Led by Yohei, Alex Reibman, and Adam Silverman, it’s open for investors on a rolling basis. Equity fund, not token-based.

Pippin Founder Yohei Nakajima launches Agent Fund, a VC fund for AI agent apps, infra, and tools. Led by Yohei, Alex Reibman, and Adam Silverman, it’s open for investors on a rolling basis. Equity fund, not token-based.
Project Updates

Story Protocol announces Emergenceverse, a franchise with a storyline created by David Goyer. David Goyer is the mastermind behind the Dark Knight trilogy and Blade. AI agents and users will build the next major franchise on-chain.
Nillion network hosts the new DeepSeek R1-14B model privately using TEEs inside nilAI. Users can now access DeepSeek while ensuring their interaction is completely private. Nillion Network is building a privacy-focused network for AI.
Hyperbolic partners with Nexus to provide GPUs for powering Nexus's ZK technology. Hyperbolic’s Eliza plugin is also live, allowing Eliza agents to autonomously use Hyperbolic GPUs
Nesa announces a fully encrypted inference API. Equivariant Encryption (EE) is an adaption of Homomorphic encryption that works on various models to provide end to end privacy on data manipulation but with zero latency.
Prime Intellect releases TOPLOC, a locality-sensitive hashing scheme for verifiable inference. It detects modifications to models, prompts, or precision and is robust across various GPU types. Prime Intellect is building the foundation for decentralized, verifiable compute protocols.
Giza crosses 11.5K autonomous transactions through ARMA, its automated on-chain yield optimizer bot. Users can deposit stablecoins for ARMA to find and optimize the best yields across multiple chains.
thirdweb, a full stack Web3 development platform, introduces Nebula for Unity, allowing game devs to build agents that talk to players and interact on-chain

Incentive Programs / Rewards

AI Agents

Virtuals is expanding to Solana, introducing a Meteora Pool, a Strategic SOL Reserve, and maintaining the AGENT/VIRTUAL trading pair. The expansion includes a Venture Partner Model with grants, an AI Hackathon, and collaboration with key partners like Jupiter Exchange and LayerZero. Virtuals also offers grants of 42K VIRTUALS tokens for aspiring projects.
Youmio partners with Virtuals to bring agents to life in 3D worlds. Virtual agents can now be brought into 3D worlds powered by Unreal Engine, opening up new possibilities and environments for these agents.
Chromia rolls out EVAL, an agent that evaluates other AI agents. Built on the Chromia engine and Virtuals ecosystem, EVAL scores AI outputs on truth, accuracy, creativity, and engagement. AIXBT received a score of 80/100.
Drift integrates with the Solana Agent Kit, enabling agents to trade perps, borrow/lend assets, and interact with Vaults. Drift is the home of on chain trading on Solana.
0G Labs releases their ERC-7857 standard. This standard is built explicitly for AI agents and enables the representation of AI agents as NFTs. This new standard includes privacy-preserving metadata where AI “intelligence” stays encrypted and secure.
OLAS announced Modius, an advanced DeFAI agent. Modius autonomously manages crypto assets with intelligent rebalancing and lending strategies.
THINK agents drops their whitepaper for their Agent Standard. The THINK Agent Standard creates the foundation for intelligent on-chain agents, making them composable and interoperable.
ai16zdao rebrands as ElizaOS after a request from the VC firm a16z. The $ai16z ticker will remain.
