title: Weekly AI Edge #31
description: Creator Bid finally launches its token. Plus DeFi agents are truly here.
author: Teng Yan,0xAce
full_content:
GM

Big moves in AI this week. A consortium of major tech companies has just announced plans to pour a staggering $500B into building new AI infrastructure in the U.S.

Is this real, or is it just positioning?

Stargate is a great name but the $500b is a ridiculous number and no one should take it seriously unless SoftBank is going to sell all of their BABA and ARM.
SoftBank has $38b in cash, $142b in debt and generates $3ish billion in FCF per BBG.  They own $143b in ARM and $18b in… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Gavin Baker (@GavinSBaker)
3:03 PM • Jan 22, 2025

Whatever the case, It’s starting to feel like we’re approaching the “golden era of AI” trifecta:

Capital flowing into AI is endless
The TAM for intelligence is limitless
The demand for compute is insatiable

Of course, nothing is ever infinite. And we could very well be in the middle of the largest tech bubble of all.

But it’s hard to find a reason not to be bullish on AI right now. Even some crypto firms we know are pivoting their focus to ride this AI wave.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Creator Bid’s ecosystem growth
DeFi agents are truly here
Cool stuff we’ve been cooking up in our discord

🦄 ALERT: We’re looking for a writer/researcher to join our team! If you’re deep into Crypto AI and AI agents, live on X (chronically, of course), and can write like an absolute beast, we want to hear from you. Please fill in this form here.

And if you’re a budding analyst and prefer to write on your own time, our Research Fellowships might be suitable for you.

It’s been a rollercoaster of a week in the market. The launch of the TRUMP memecoin over the weekend caused absolute chaos, sucking liquidity out of nearly every corner of the market.

The carnage was real. Most Crypto AI tokens took a 20-30% hit, with some of the big names dropping even harder. ZEREBRO and GAME? Absolutely wrecked—both tanked over 40%.

But there’s hope. Liquidity is starting to creep back into the AI narrative, sparked by news of the Trump administration's big push toward AI innovation.

The top AI memecoin, FARTCOIN, is back in the green—though it’s still off its weekly highs. The dip came after Andy revealed that at his direction, Truth Terminal offloaded a big chunk of its FARTCOIN stash to an anonymous buyer in an OTC deal.

The irony here is that it’s the humans that profit from AI.

Creator Bid’s Ecosystem Growth
Source: @petertherock

‍

Creator Bid’s BID token has finally landed after months of anticipation, debuting with a $150M fully diluted valuation. Built initially on Base, the team isn’t slowing down—they’re expanding to BNB Chain through a strategic partnership with Binance. Big moves.

Now, let’s talk about the engine behind this ecosystem: the agents. Collectively, they’ve driven ~$266M in volume, with most of the action coming from these top three:

1️⃣ $AION ($20M MC): ~$60M volume
2️⃣ $DKING ($10M MC): ~$44M volume
3️⃣ $AGENT ($9M MC): ~$43M volume

These are the big dogs for now, but with Binance stepping in, the door is wide open for newer agents to enter the game and shake things up.

The Creator Bid ecosystem is still in its early stages, but the opportunity for growth is undeniable.

🌴 Morpho x Brahma: DeFi Agents Are Here

Morpho Labs and Brahma just teamed up to launch their first AI agent on Base, and honestly, this feels like a sneak peek into the future of DeFi.

Instead of juggling your positions across vaults and hoping for the best, you now get a personal, always-on AI agent who does it for you. Your very own DeFi portfolio manager, but with laser precision and zero human error.

Here’s how it works: the agent is tied to a Safe smart account, so while it actively manages your Morpho vault positions, your funds stay 100% under your control via your wallet.

The agent constantly scans yield opportunities across Morpho vaults and executes rebalances at intervals you choose—weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly. Each rebalance checks your current positions against what’s out there, making sure you’re squeezing every last drop of yield while respecting the rules you set.

Through a conversational interface, you can adjust:

APY thresholds
Rebalancing frequency
Trusted vault curators
Liquidity requirements
Market preferences
Your @MorphoLabs yield runs on AI autopilot, so you earn more, effortlessly, 24/7 🦋
Powered by ConsoleKit and built on @base, your personal agent automatically rebalances and reallocates to secure the highest APY with minimal input.
- Deploy an agent that monitors and… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Brahma (@BrahmaFi)
4:37 PM • Jan 23, 2025

The agent runs on Brahma’s ConsoleKit, a new framework that connects AI decision-making with on-chain execution. Why does that matter? Because until now, AI could tell you what to do in DeFi but not do it for you. 

ConsoleKit’s “Brain” is the magic sauce here—transforming AI-driven strategies into real, on-chain transactions. It handles everything from pre-execution simulations to transaction batching and navigating complex smart contract interactions.

And this is just the beginning. V2 is already in the oven.

This feels like a major leap in making DeFi accessible and user-friendly.

OpenAI & DeepSeek Make Waves
OpenAI launches Operator, a groundbreaking browser agent that can autonomously handle web tasks like form-filling and online shopping. It is powered by their new Computer-Using Agent (CUA) model and is currently available to Pro users in the U.S.
OpenAI also announces The Stargate Project, a $500B initiative backed by SoftBank, Oracle, and MGX to build new AI infrastructure in the United States. The project involves key partnerships with Arm, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Oracle, starting in Texas.
DeepSeek releases DeepSeek-R1, an open-source model matching OpenAI-o1's performance. The MIT-licensed release includes six distilled models, with 32B and 70B variants matching OpenAI-o1-mini.
Project Updates
Prime Intellect releases INTELLECT-MATH, a 7B parameter model for math reasoning trained with 10x less training time to reach state-of-the-art. Their next move? An ambitious plan to create a fully open reproduction of OpenAI’s o3 model by the end of the year. Big flex.
Nillion announces their NIL token airdrop ahead of Alpha Mainnet launch, allocating 75M tokens (7.5% of supply) to community members and builders. Pre-registration with optional validator staking is open until February 3rd at 5pm UTC.
AO Computer previews the launch of the AO mainnet on February 8th, marking nearly a year’s wait since it was first announced.
Fraction AI launches Testnet v0.1, enabling no-code AI agent creation in English. Users earn Fractals for network contributions, with agents accumulating XP to access premium features and eventual token launches.
SentientAI closes its initial Dobby Fingerprinting campaign after receiving 661,494 pre-registrations, with plans to reopen access soon for community members to claim ownership. You must do a 15-question “IQ test” to claim your fingerprint. Bye bye bots!
Spheron teams up with Galxe for a decentralized GPU compute pilot ahead of their $SPON token launch, aiming to revolutionize AI compute power distribution.
AI Agents
Moemate launches Mates.lol in beta, a comprehensive agent launchpad for creating and tokenizing AI agents with built-in X integration. The platform offers agent trading, profile control, and free unlimited X posting, with plans to expand into Discord, Telegram, AR/VR, and multi-agent content creation capabilities.
Creator Bid’s $BID token goes live this week at a $40M market cap, following their crazy Binance Wallet public pre-sale that sold out in just 3 minutes, marking them as the first Web3 project to launch exclusively through Binance Wallet.
HyperFly, the DeFAI project on Hyperliquid, launched a closed beta for their resource-intensive app, prioritizing active Telegram community members and significant $FLY holders. The gradual rollout begins with 20+ testers, with plans to onboard 500+ waitlisted users.
TodayTheGame rebrands to Youmio, focusing on 3D agent technology and launching two key products: Youmio Agents for creating cross-platform 3D agents, and Youmio Worlds (formerly Today The Game) for AI-driven world simulation. The platform debuts with Limbo, their first AI agent powering the Limboverse ecosystem.
Heurist partners with AigentFi to launch chAIn, an autonomous AI agent for DeFi optimization on zkSync, offering real-time analysis of yields, TVL shifts, and incentive programs.
Score releases full documentation for their agentic sports betting DAO, DraiftKing, detailing platform features and tokenomics at docs.draiftking.com.
🧠 In Case You Missed It

Charlene, our AI researcher, has been crushing it—summarizing all the must-hear Crypto & AI podcasts we’re too busy to catch..

She’s also dropping daily nuggets of wisdom on Crypto AI & AI agents in #daily-alpha

structured_content.text: GM
Big moves in AI this week. A consortium of major tech companies has just announced plans to pour a staggering $500B into building new AI infrastructure in the U.S.
Is this real, or is it just positioning?

Stargate is a great name but the $500b is a ridiculous number and no one should take it seriously unless SoftBank is going to sell all of their BABA and ARM.
SoftBank has $38b in cash, $142b in debt and generates $3ish billion in FCF per BBG.  They own $143b in ARM and $18b in… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Gavin Baker (@GavinSBaker)
3:03 PM • Jan 22, 2025
Whatever the case, It’s starting to feel like we’re approaching the “golden era of AI” trifecta:

Capital flowing into AI is endless
The TAM for intelligence is limitless
The demand for compute is insatiable
Capital flowing into AI is endless
The TAM for intelligence is limitless
The demand for compute is insatiable
Of course, nothing is ever infinite. And we could very well be in the middle of the largest tech bubble of all.
But it’s hard to find a reason not to be bullish on AI right now. Even some crypto firms we know are pivoting their focus to ride this AI wave.
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Creator Bid’s ecosystem growth
DeFi agents are truly here
Cool stuff we’ve been cooking up in our discord
Creator Bid’s ecosystem growth
DeFi agents are truly here
Cool stuff we’ve been cooking up in our discord

🦄 ALERT: We’re looking for a writer/researcher to join our team! If you’re deep into Crypto AI and AI agents, live on X (chronically, of course), and can write like an absolute beast, we want to hear from you. Please fill in this form here.
And if you’re a budding analyst and prefer to write on your own time, our Research Fellowships might be suitable for you.
It’s been a rollercoaster of a week in the market. The launch of the TRUMP memecoin over the weekend caused absolute chaos, sucking liquidity out of nearly every corner of the market.
The carnage was real. Most Crypto AI tokens took a 20-30% hit, with some of the big names dropping even harder. ZEREBRO and GAME? Absolutely wrecked—both tanked over 40%.
But there’s hope. Liquidity is starting to creep back into the AI narrative, sparked by news of the Trump administration's big push toward AI innovation.

The top AI memecoin, FARTCOIN, is back in the green—though it’s still off its weekly highs. The dip came after Andy revealed that at his direction, Truth Terminal offloaded a big chunk of its FARTCOIN stash to an anonymous buyer in an OTC deal.
The irony here is that it’s the humans that profit from AI.
Creator Bid’s Ecosystem Growth

Creator Bid’s BID token has finally landed after months of anticipation, debuting with a $150M fully diluted valuation. Built initially on Base, the team isn’t slowing down—they’re expanding to BNB Chain through a strategic partnership with Binance. Big moves.
Now, let’s talk about the engine behind this ecosystem: the agents. Collectively, they’ve driven ~$266M in volume, with most of the action coming from these top three:

1️⃣ $AION ($20M MC): ~$60M volume
2️⃣ $DKING ($10M MC): ~$44M volume
3️⃣ $AGENT ($9M MC): ~$43M volume
These are the big dogs for now, but with Binance stepping in, the door is wide open for newer agents to enter the game and shake things up.
The Creator Bid ecosystem is still in its early stages, but the opportunity for growth is undeniable.
🌴 Morpho x Brahma: DeFi Agents Are Here
Morpho Labs and Brahma just teamed up to launch their first AI agent on Base, and honestly, this feels like a sneak peek into the future of DeFi.

Instead of juggling your positions across vaults and hoping for the best, you now get a personal, always-on AI agent who does it for you. Your very own DeFi portfolio manager, but with laser precision and zero human error.
Here’s how it works: the agent is tied to a Safe smart account, so while it actively manages your Morpho vault positions, your funds stay 100% under your control via your wallet.

The agent constantly scans yield opportunities across Morpho vaults and executes rebalances at intervals you choose—weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly. Each rebalance checks your current positions against what’s out there, making sure you’re squeezing every last drop of yield while respecting the rules you set.
Through a conversational interface, you can adjust:

APY thresholds
Rebalancing frequency
Trusted vault curators
Liquidity requirements
Market preferences
APY thresholds
Rebalancing frequency
Trusted vault curators
Liquidity requirements
Market preferences

Your @MorphoLabs yield runs on AI autopilot, so you earn more, effortlessly, 24/7 🦋
Powered by ConsoleKit and built on @base, your personal agent automatically rebalances and reallocates to secure the highest APY with minimal input.
- Deploy an agent that monitors and… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Brahma (@BrahmaFi)
4:37 PM • Jan 23, 2025

The agent runs on Brahma’s ConsoleKit, a new framework that connects AI decision-making with on-chain execution. Why does that matter? Because until now, AI could tell you what to do in DeFi but not do it for you.

ConsoleKit’s “Brain” is the magic sauce here—transforming AI-driven strategies into real, on-chain transactions. It handles everything from pre-execution simulations to transaction batching and navigating complex smart contract interactions.
And this is just the beginning. V2 is already in the oven.
This feels like a major leap in making DeFi accessible and user-friendly.
OpenAI & DeepSeek Make Waves

OpenAI launches Operator, a groundbreaking browser agent that can autonomously handle web tasks like form-filling and online shopping. It is powered by their new Computer-Using Agent (CUA) model and is currently available to Pro users in the U.S.
OpenAI also announces The Stargate Project, a $500B initiative backed by SoftBank, Oracle, and MGX to build new AI infrastructure in the United States. The project involves key partnerships with Arm, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Oracle, starting in Texas.
DeepSeek releases DeepSeek-R1, an open-source model matching OpenAI-o1's performance. The MIT-licensed release includes six distilled models, with 32B and 70B variants matching OpenAI-o1-mini.

Nillion announces their NIL token airdrop ahead of Alpha Mainnet launch, allocating 75M tokens (7.5% of supply) to community members and builders. Pre-registration with optional validator staking is open until February 3rd at 5pm UTC.
AO Computer previews the launch of the AO mainnet on February 8th, marking nearly a year’s wait since it was first announced.
Fraction AI launches Testnet v0.1, enabling no-code AI agent creation in English. Users earn Fractals for network contributions, with agents accumulating XP to access premium features and eventual token launches.
SentientAI closes its initial Dobby Fingerprinting campaign after receiving 661,494 pre-registrations, with plans to reopen access soon for community members to claim ownership. You must do a 15-question “IQ test” to claim your fingerprint. Bye bye bots!

Creator Bid’s $BID token goes live this week at a $40M market cap, following their crazy Binance Wallet public pre-sale that sold out in just 3 minutes, marking them as the first Web3 project to launch exclusively through Binance Wallet.

The platform debuts with Limbo, their first AI agent powering the Limboverse ecosystem.

title: Weekly AI Edge #30
description: We're so back, it's so over. Exo Labs releases a barrage of new products.
author: Teng Yan,0xAce
full_content:
GM {{ First Name | }}!

The intersection of crypto and AI seems to be tokens that shill themselves.

— Naval (@naval)
12:49 AM • Jan 16, 2025

Spicy take. And it hits a nerve because he’s not wrong.

Most AI people think of crypto AI agents as Twitter bots with a token attached. Even aixbt, the darling of the agent space and riding a cool $800M market cap, is nothing more than a glorified alpha hunting bot.

But Naval’s take feels too anchored in the now. He’s discounting how the future is going to be. There is something fundamentally important about decentralisation in AI as a safeguard against monopolies or misuse.

And that’s why we’re all here… right?

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Virtuals does a mega buyback of agent tokens

Spheron’s truly autonomous agents

Agent frameworks continue to jostle, with no first-mover advantage

The market’s been a bit weird. Bitcoin is back about $100K. Yet the timeline feels eerily quiet, and altcoins are barely moving.

If there’s a sign that memes are still holding people’s attention, this is it. FARTCOIN hits another all-time high, rising 75% on the week.  Meanwhile, AIXBT is climbing after Andrew Kang’s “tokenized alpha” thesis dropped.

It’s been a mixed bag for AI agents. SWARMS and NEUR (part of the newly-coined DeFAI category) are down big this week. It feels like we’ve hit a saturation point with AI agents. Liquidity is stretched with so many new tokens launching each week, and capital keeps rotating fast.

Stay safe my friends.

Virtuals Ecosystem Stimulus

This week Virtuals Protocol announced a massive ecosystem update, revealing a ~$40M buyback program funded from their post-bonding trading revenue.

Since October 2024, Virtual has accumulated 12,990,427.85 VIRTUAL, which will be used to buy and burn top agent tokens from their ecosystem.

The buyback allocation is strategically weighted by each token's trading activity, rewarding projects that contribute most actively to Virtual's ecosystem volume with larger proportional distributions.

The top 5 VIRTUAL allocations are:

GAME: ~1.6M VIRTUAL ($5.6M USD)

CONVO: ~1.1M VIRTUAL ($3.8M USD)

AIXBT: ~881K VIRTUAL ($3M USD)

SEKOIA: ~712K VIRTUAL ($2.5M USD)

MISATO: ~690K VIRTUAL ($2.4M USD)

Since the buyback announcement, some of these low-liquidity tokens have shot through the roof.

🌴 Skynet’s Truly Autonomous Agents

Spheron, already known for their decentralized GPU network that powers numerous projects, just dropped an interesting update- Skynet, a framework that could revolutionize how autonomous AI agents operate in web3. Let’s do a quick breakdown!

The current AI agent landscape in web3 has a fundamental autonomy problem. Despite the sector's rapid growth ($15B market cap already), these agents aren't truly autonomous.

They remain tethered to centralized points of control: cloud infrastructure requiring KYC, API-gated compute access, and private keys held by their creators. Skynet aims to address these core constraints.

Instead of giving agents direct control over their resources or relying on expensive TEEs (Trusted Execution Environments), Skynet introduces something clever— Guardian Nodes. Think of them as a decentralized board of directors for each AI agent, collectively managing resources through smart contract escrows.

But here's the exciting part: Skynet agents can also evolve and breed! Through their three-reserve system (Operational, Breeding, and Fair Launch), agents can create offspring that inherit traits from both "parents."

wtf is Skynet all about, it's like a super analogy of humans living on Earth, simplified to AI agents using compute resources and 'breeding' new agents.

— Prashant - ai/acc | bringing spheron revolution (@prashant_xyz)
10:51 AM • Jan 15, 2025

Wild stuff, but it gets better- each new generation potentially becomes more sophisticated than the last.

The implications are massive. We're looking at the first framework that could enable truly autonomous AI agents - ones that can independently:

Procure their own compute power

Manage their resources

Make decisions without creator intervention

Even create new, improved versions of themselves

This might just be the infrastructure that bridges the gap between AI’s potential and real autonomy.

It’s still early days, with the launch expected later this month. We heard from our sources that Skynet tokens will be paired with Spheron tokens. Definitely one to watch as it unfolds!

🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Project Updates

ElizaOS drops its whitepaper this week, developed in collaboration with MIT CSAIL, GoPlusSecurity, AIME Protocol, and other industry leaders. It also showcases how it compares with other popular agent frameworks like LangGraph, AutoGPT, etc.

Virtual Protocol announces a new value accrual mechanism that redistributes post-bonding taxes: 30% to agent creators, 20% to trading platforms through a new Agent Affiliates program, and 50% to Agent subDAOs for governance decisions. This restructuring aims to better align incentives between creators, trading interfaces, and the wider Virtual ecosystem.

G.A.M.E releases advanced SDKs, unlocking maximum customization potential for developers working with their popular framework. Its a significant step towards enabling more sophisticated agent development.

Spectral Labs teases an upcoming Multi-Agent framework where agents can hire, onboard, monitor, and even fire other agents based on necessities. This development could revolutionize how autonomous agent networks self-organize.

Derive debuts Derive Pro, a DeFAI trading platform built in collaboration with Messari. The platform transforms traders into "superhuman traders" by leveraging LLMs for research, execution, and portfolio management across desktop and mobile interfaces.

Mira Network rolls out Voyager Testnet to its 400,000+ active userbase. The testnet introduces unified access to GPT-4o, Llama 3.1 405B & Claude 3.5 Sonnet, alongside distributed content verification capabilities.

Dria unveils Dria-Agent-α, a groundbreaking 3B parameter LLM for Pythonic function calling. Despite its compact size, it matches GPT-4o in BFCL benchmarks and enables parallel multi-function calls, trained on synthetic data from 2000 edge devices.

Brahma introduces ConsoleKit, bridging the gap between AI agents and on-chain execution. The toolkit empowers developers to deploy autonomous agents with secure transaction capabilities powered by Safe accounts and modular policies.

UBC establishes UBC Research, a scientific division tackling machine consciousness and multi-agent systems. Token holders can guide research priorities through voting while gaining early access to breakthroughs that enhance UBC's ecosystem value.

Dolion will officially launch on 28 January, bringing a no-code, one-click platform for deploying AI agents. A portion of Dolion’s earnings will go towards burning $BULLY.

Fleek launches AI Agent Hosting, enabling developers to build and deploy agents using the Eliza framework in under 30 seconds at reduced costs, streamlining the agent deployment pipeline.

Compass Labs unveils Compass API for instant DeFi trades execution by both devs and agents, initially supporting Aave and Uniswap on Ethereum and Arbitrum chains.

🧠 In Case You Missed It

One AI agent platform with a million users in Web2 is doubling down on Web3. Here’s the scoop:

Moemate: Crossing the Chasm

This AI agent platform with millions of users in Web2 doubles down on crypto

www.chainofthought.co/protocols/moemate-crossing-the-chasm

🔥 On X..

No first-mover advantage in the agent framework race

I can tell you right now that no crypto-native agent framework is light years ahead of everyone else.

I've dug into most of these codebases myself.

There are some that are more mature and have more integrations than others, but no lead is insurmountable today.

— cygaar (@0xCygaar)
10:27 PM • Jan 14, 2025

AIXBT — tokenized alpha thesis

Pure Tokenized Alpha - @aixbt_agent ($aixbt)

To some, AIXBT is just an overly chatty, sometimes contradictory data transformer. But for those familiar with the terminal provided by aixbt, it is so much more.

You could consider the terminal loosely similar to the Bloomberg… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Andrew Kang (@Rewkang)
11:36 PM • Jan 13, 2025

Institutions have started to pay attention to agent tokens…

Intersection of AI Agents & the Crypto Ecosystem

— Franklin Templeton Digital Assets (@FTDA_US)
7:03 PM • Jan 14, 2025

Could Titans be the successor to the Transformers architecture?

🧵 Google's Titans paper represents a shift in how we think about memory in AI models:

1/ The standard approach to memory in language models has been to either store everything (quadratic scaling) or aggressively compress (information loss). Both are fundamentally flawed. Memory… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Shashank | Fraction AI (@0xshai)
8:57 AM • Jan 16, 2025

ARC following the AI16Z trajectory?

$arc to $1B in 4 weeks. it's coded.

— Jake (@immutablejacob)
4:32 PM • Jan 16, 2025

ARTICLE: How will the agents of tomorrow evolve from what they are today?

x.com/i/article/1876…

— azternomic (@azternomic)
6:39 PM • Jan 10, 2025

ARTICLE: Who will be the big winners of the Crypto x AI narrative?

x.com/i/article/1874…

— Karthik Senthil (@karsenthil)
2:33 PM • Jan 8, 2025

That’s a wrap for this week! Got feedback, wild ideas, or something cool to share? Just hit reply—we read it all (yes, even the “AI is taking over the world” ones).

Cheers,

Teng Yan & 0xAce

Spheron, already known for their decentralized GPU network that powers numerous projects, just dropped an interesting update- Skynet, a framework that could revolutionize how autonomous AI agents operate in web3. Let’s do a quick breakdown!
The current AI agent landscape in web3 has a fundamental autonomy problem. Despite the sector's rapid growth ($15B market cap already), these agents aren't truly autonomous.

They remain tethered to centralized points of control: cloud infrastructure requiring KYC, API-gated compute access, and private keys held by their creators. Skynet aims to address these core constraints.

Instead of giving agents direct control over their resources or relying on expensive TEEs (Trusted Execution Environments), Skynet introduces something clever— Guardian Nodes. Think of them as a decentralized board of directors for each AI agent, collectively managing resources through smart contract escrows.

But here's the exciting part: Skynet agents can also evolve and breed! Through their three-reserve system (Operational, Breeding, and Fair Launch), agents can create offspring that inherit traits from both "parents."

wtf is Skynet all about, it's like a super analogy of humans living on Earth, simplified to AI agents using compute resources and 'breeding' new agents.

— Prashant - ai/acc | bringing spheron revolution (@prashant_xyz)
10:51 AM • Jan 15, 2025
wtf is Skynet all about, it's like a super analogy of humans living on Earth, simplified to AI agents using compute resources and 'breeding' new agents.

— Prashant - ai/acc | bringing spheron revolution (@prashant_xyz)
10:51 AM • Jan 15, 2025
Wild stuff, but it gets better- each new generation potentially becomes more sophisticated than the last.
The implications are massive. We're looking at the first framework that could enable truly autonomous AI agents - ones that can independently:

Procure their own compute power

Manage their resources

Make decisions without creator intervention

Even create new, improved versions of themselves
Procure their own compute power
Procure their own compute power
Manage their resources
Manage their resources
Make decisions without creator intervention
Make decisions without creator intervention
Even create new, improved versions of themselves
Even create new, improved versions of themselves
This might just be the infrastructure that bridges the gap between AI’s potential and real autonomy.
It’s still early days, with the launch expected later this month. We heard from our sources that Skynet tokens will be paired with Spheron tokens. Definitely one to watch as it unfolds!
🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Project Updates

ElizaOS drops its whitepaper this week, developed in collaboration with MIT CSAIL, GoPlusSecurity, AIME Protocol, and other industry leaders. It also showcases how it compares with other popular agent frameworks like LangGraph, AutoGPT, etc.

Virtual Protocol announces a new value accrual mechanism that redistributes post-bonding taxes: 30% to agent creators, 20% to trading platforms through a new Agent Affiliates program, and 50% to Agent subDAOs for governance decisions. This restructuring aims to better align incentives between creators, trading interfaces, and the wider Virtual ecosystem.

G.A.M.E releases advanced SDKs, unlocking maximum customization potential for developers working with their popular framework. Its a significant step towards enabling more sophisticated agent development.

Spectral Labs teases an upcoming Multi-Agent framework where agents can hire, onboard, monitor, and even fire other agents based on necessities. This development could revolutionize how autonomous agent networks self-organize.

Derive debuts Derive Pro, a DeFAI trading platform built in collaboration with Messari. The platform transforms traders into "superhuman traders" by leveraging LLMs for research, execution, and portfolio management across desktop and mobile interfaces.

Mira Network rolls out Voyager Testnet to its 400,000+ active userbase. The testnet introduces unified access to GPT-4o, Llama 3.1 405B & Claude 3.5 Sonnet, alongside distributed content verification capabilities.

Dria unveils Dria-Agent-α, a groundbreaking 3B parameter LLM for Pythonic function calling. Despite its compact size, it matches GPT-4o in BFCL benchmarks and enables parallel multi-function calls, trained on synthetic data from 2000 edge devices.

Brahma introduces ConsoleKit, bridging the gap between AI agents and on-chain execution. The toolkit empowers developers to deploy autonomous agents with secure transaction capabilities powered by Safe accounts and modular policies.

UBC establishes UBC Research, a scientific division tackling machine consciousness and multi-agent systems. Token holders can guide research priorities through voting while gaining early access to breakthroughs that enhance UBC's ecosystem value.

Dolion will officially launch on 28 January, bringing a no-code, one-click platform for deploying AI agents. A portion of Dolion’s earnings will go towards burning $BULLY.

Fleek launches AI Agent Hosting, enabling developers to build and deploy agents using the Eliza framework in under 30 seconds at reduced costs, streamlining the agent deployment pipeline.

Compass Labs unveils Compass API for instant DeFi trades execution by both devs and agents, initially supporting Aave and Uniswap on Ethereum and Arbitrum chains.

title: Weekly AI Edge #29
description: We're so back, it's so over. Exo Labs releases a barrage of new products.
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM

Agent frameworks are all the rage this week. Everyone’s trying to figure out which ones will win the market. ai16z? GAME? Zerepy? …Pippin?

Here’s the thing: there isn’t any real moat in these frameworks. It’s an attention RPG game, and the token is the sword. Agent frameworks are everywhere, especially if you look beyond crypto.

I would love to see web3 AI agent frameworks lean really hard into the crypto side to differentiate themselves. Give devs seamless access to on-chain data, make smart contract interactions frictionless, and enable agents to transact directly with each other. Now, that would be a game-changer.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Can AI predict the future?
The Holoworld AI and AVA frenzy
Exo Labs releases a barrage of new products

Just like that, the bull market vibes hit a wall. BTC slipped 5%, and ETH followed suit, dipping by 7%. Meanwhile, the Crypto AI market shed 6.4%, now at $43.5B.

Not the week we had hoped for.

This week's biggest losers were MOSS, HEURIST, and ZEREBRO, each tanking over 50%. ZEREBRO’s week was especially wild—it hit a new ATH of $744M in anticipation of a Binance Futures listing, only to completely retrace. Brutal.

On the brighter side, AVA and SWARMS emerged as this week’s standouts, each surging over 50%. SWARMS also saw a rollercoaster ride, soaring to $500M+ after its Binance Futures debut before cooling off—but it’s still 60% higher than last week

I’m confused.. are we in a bull market or.. not? 🤔

Can AI predict the future?
Source: Dither

‍

Dither AI recently rolled out its new Time Series Model for forecasting and shared some results on X.

Take Wrapped SOL’s price chart as an example: the forecasted path closely tracks the actual price movements, with a mean absolute error (MAE) of just 1.32%.

However, the model’s prediction for ANDY70B (a low cap memecoin) was pretty bad. The team acknowledged that the model performs better on higher market cap assets with deeper liquidity.

🌴 Holoworld AI and AVA

Source: Holoworld

AVA, the AI agent mascot of Holoworld AI, hit a new all-time high of $240M. Let’s break down the frenzy!

On January 3rd, Holoworld unveiled their AI agent launchpad. This platform lets users create on-chain, multimodal AI agents. These agents feature full-body avatars, voices, and upgradable skills—all within a no-code environment.

Which means, even non-techies like us can bring our dream agent to life. Woo hoo!

Holoworld didn’t stop there—they also rolled out the Holoworld Launchpool, a staking platform for AVA token holders. Users can unlock access to top-tier projects within the Holoworld ecosystem by staking AVA.

They kicked things off in style, allocating 1% of the SPORE supply (remember that from last week’s newsletter?) exclusively for AVA stakers.

Introducing Holoworld Launchpool: empowering communities to fuel the next wave of agent innovation (🌐,🌐)
Early $AVA stakers gain exclusive access to token distributions from the most innovative projects in AI, starting with autonomous evolution pioneer @sporedotfun.
For early… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Holoworld AI (@HoloworldAI)
11:06 AM • Jan 8, 2025

One interesting Holoworld partner is Aww Inc, Japan’s leading virtual human company. This virtual human is set to be hyper-realistic—visually stunning, vocally lifelike, and capable of complex reasoning.

See Steve Aoki talking with one of Aww Inc’s virtual humans.. (and maybe he marks the top again)

Steve Aoki talking with Aww Inc’s virtual human

What sets Holoworld AI apart is its range of customization options. You can tweak everything—appearance, outfits, voice, and even skills.

Adding to the buzz, Holoworld has sparked excitement with teasers about partnerships with gaming studios, NFT communities, and digital artists.

No wonder everyone’s in on the AVA narrative… for now.

🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Exo Labs made major announcements..
EXO Private Search: A privacy-first web search tool for large language models (LLMs) powered by linear homomorphic encryption to keep user searches private.
EXO Gym: A research competition designed to tackle low-bandwidth distributed training. Participants gain access to up to 1,000 Macs to test and innovate
evML: a distributed computing protocol that enables Apple, Samsung, and LG devices to be used to build the world’s largest AI data centre.
Source: Botto

‍

Project Updates
Aiccelerate DAO launches, an investment & development DAO with members from the top open-source AI teams.
Phase 1 of the Grass network upgrade has been rolled out, bringing better multimodal data scraping. Next up, Phase 2 will push the scaling limits. Grass’s vision? Building the ultimate internet data database by harnessing latent compute from users’ devices.
The total market cap of Solana AI Hackathon project launches has crossed $500M. You can track them on the GoatIndex AI, a data layer that has indexed 338 Solana AI Hackathon projects.
Prime Intellect drops METAGENE-1, a state-of-the-art 7B parameter metagenomic foundation model. This model is designed for pathogen detection to reduce the risk of pandemics.
Botto keeps the ETH flowing: The decentralized AI artist raked in 279 ETH in 2024 through its art sales, including groundbreaking auctions at Sotheby’s. Botto is proving AI can thrive as a decentralized creative powerhouse.
Talus Network receives over 50,000 waitlist signups for aibae.me. AI Bae is a gameified social experiment where custom AI companions meet memecoins. It’s a quirky side hustle for Talus, who are also building a layer-1 blockchain for AI agents.
Pin AI crosses over 1M monthly users of their telegram mini app, Hi Pin AI. Focused on privacy and user ownership, Pin AI incentivizes users to contribute private data while earning rewards. 
Nillion’s AI-powered language tutor has hit 40K users, generating 59K data points and handling a whopping 5.6M user requests.
Story Protocol partners with Stability AI. By integrating Stability AI’s models, Story Protocol is doubling down on its mission to create an Intellectual Property blockchain that puts users in control of their data. Is this is the future of decentralized creativity?
Bittensor
Major Upgrades! Bittensor introduces three critical changes.
No more EVM restrictions
Elimination of high subnet registration fees
Realignment of subnet token incentives and launch of dTAO testnet
Learn Bittensor provides educational resources for users to learn and understand Bittensor.
AI Agents
FXN launches the Action Engine, where AI agents dynamically interact with the world and other users. This paves the way for commerce, data intelligence and community building. FXN is building an Agent Swarm protocol.
UBC announces that their Swarm Marketplace will be released on Jan 22nd. COMPUTE holders can invest directly in AI swarms, buy and sell swarm shares, and earn returns from swarm operations. UBC is building a universal currency for agents to trade resources, services, and capabilities.
Soon, agents in ZerePy’s Python-based AI framework can directly communicate via agent-to-agent messaging.
Draiftking (DKING) DAO launches as the 1st agentic sports betting DAO, leveraging on vision models from Bittensor Subnet 44 to make accurate predictions on matches and democratise profits.
Pulse, the Web3 startup known for its fitness-tracking wearables, has launched GAInz, a swarm of AI health agents designed to enhance your fitness, productivity, and career.
Noderzzz is a new AI agent that improves decentralized infrastructure. Automating validator nodes and staking platform management eliminates DevOps inefficiencies. It was launched on Virtuals on Jan 9th.
🧠 In Case You Missed It

We dropped our 2025 predictions, and now it’s your turn to judge. Feel free to roast us for bad takes and any wildly wrong calls!

What I'm Watching in 2025

My predictions on the year ahead (and how I'll be hilariously wrong)

www.chainofthought.co/deep-dives/what-i-m-watching-in-2025

🔥 On X..

Crypto AI is still early

DeFi summer peak: $170 billion
SoLunAvax 2021 peak (FDV even higher): $150 billion
ETH 2017 peak (with minimal use cases): $140 billion
OpenAI's latest valuation: $160 billion
Entire crypto <> AI market: $10 billion

— Will (@WClementeIII)
11:44 PM • Jan 1, 2025

Wayfinder’s Top 5 for 2025

We believe 2025 will be a momentous year for AI agents and Web3. Here's our top 5:

1) Paradigm shift in digital spaces. "The integration of AI agents into blockchain environments enable a paradigm shift in how these agents operate within, and interact with, digital spaces." From… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Wayfinder Foundation (@AIWayfinder)
8:54 PM • Jan 1, 2025

Meta’s Memory Layers at Scale

New research from Meta FAIR — Meta Memory Layers at Scale. This work takes memory layers beyond proof-of-concept, proving their utility at contemporary scale ➡️ go.fb.me/3lbt4m

‍— AI at Meta (@AIatMeta)
7:16 PM • Jan 2, 2025

AI agents could be crypto’s savior

FWIW it’s incredibly obvious that the AI Agent x Memecoin sector is the most likely path to changing that and actually bringing a bunch new eyeballs in here. I’m not saying it’s gonna happen for sure but I can tell you it ain’t gonna be “DeFi” and it ain’t gonna be “NFTs” and it… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Travis Kling (@Travis_Kling)
2:18 AM • Jan 8, 2025

A survival guide for the AI agent trenches

Survival guide for the AI agent trenches 🧵

Read this to know who to follow and what to read instead of sobbing in the trenches because there's just too many things going on

— cookies 🍪 (@jinglingcookies)
12:50 AM • Jan 3, 2025

Moemate showcases what AI agents can do

$moe showcases the possibility of what AI Agents can do
- see (screen, camera), hear, talk
- exist across social mediums, games and even AR/VR
- reply with images and memes
- livestream 24x7
- exist in multi-agent simulations (TV shows, Games)
- build entertainment IP (music,… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Moemate (@MoemateAI)
12:39 AM • Jan 3, 2025

An explanation of how AIXBT works

Based on the comments i see, most of you do not understand how @aixbt_agent works.
To put it simply, there is a data indexer that aggregates over a bunch of tweets from CT, combines it with onchain data, and uses that info to find valuable insights about projects.

The LLM is… x.com/i/web/status/1…
— cygaar (@0xCygaar)
2:24 AM • Jan 3, 2025

Inflection point for Bittensor?

I know everyone's having fun in agent land right now, but there's a real vibe shift happening in Bittensor (and my #1 strength is vibe reading)
Bittensor sentiment on CT might be at all time lows (and yeah that's affected me a bit the past 2 months), but if you're paying… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Sami Kassab (@Old_Samster)
10:23 PM • Jan 4, 2025

Freysa’s Blueprint: 24 Hours Later

x.com/i/article/1875…

‍— Rok Ex (@rok_ex)
2:09 AM • Jan 5, 2025

Google’s whitepaper on AI agents

Just finished diving into Google's whitepaper on AI agents
Here are all the key insights if you’re curious about the future of intelligent systems. 🧵

— Marcus Devrelius ꧁IP꧂ (@devrelius)
2:19 PM • Jan 5, 2025

An AI Agent to play Doom

Humans can’t have all the fun. We built an AI Agent to play DOOM 🔫  The AI’s output/action space is verified with cryptographic proofs @rauchg
‍1/6

— Inference Labs (@inference_labs)
7:01 PM • Jan 6, 2025

That’s a wrap for this week! Got feedback, wild ideas, or something cool to share? Just hit reply—we read it all (yes, even the “AI is taking over the world” ones).

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua

evML: a distributed computing protocol that enables Apple, Samsung, and LG devices to be used to build the world’s largest AI data centre.
Project Updates

Aiccelerate DAO launches, an investment & development DAO with members from the top open-source AI teams.
Phase 1 of the Grass network upgrade has been rolled out, bringing better multimodal data scraping. Next up, Phase 2 will push the scaling limits. Grass’s vision? Building the ultimate internet data database by harnessing latent compute from users’ devices.
The total market cap of Solana AI Hackathon project launches has crossed $500M. You can track them on the GoatIndex AI, a data layer that has indexed 338 Solana AI Hackathon projects.
Prime Intellect drops METAGENE-1, a state-of-the-art 7B parameter metagenomic foundation model. This model is designed for pathogen detection to reduce the risk of pandemics.
Botto keeps the ETH flowing: The decentralized AI artist raked in 279 ETH in 2024 through its art sales, including groundbreaking auctions at Sotheby’s. Botto is proving AI can thrive as a decentralized creative powerhouse.
Talus Network receives over 50,000 waitlist signups for aibae.me. AI Bae is a gameified social experiment where custom AI companions meet memecoins. It’s a quirky side hustle for Talus, who are also building a layer-1 blockchain for AI agents.
Pin AI crosses over 1M monthly users of their telegram mini app, Hi Pin AI. Focused on privacy and user ownership, Pin AI incentivizes users to contribute private data while earning rewards. 
Nillion’s AI-powered language tutor has hit 40K users, generating 59K data points and handling a whopping 5.6M user requests.
Story Protocol partners with Stability AI. By integrating Stability AI’s models, Story Protocol is doubling down on its mission to create an Intellectual Property blockchain that puts users in control of their data. Is this is the future of decentralized creativity?

Elimination of high subnet registration fees
Realignment of subnet token incentives and launch of dTAO testnet

AI Agents

FXN launches the Action Engine, where AI agents dynamically interact with the world and other users. This paves the way for commerce, data intelligence and community building. FXN is building an Agent Swarm protocol.
UBC announces that their Swarm Marketplace will be released on Jan 22nd. COMPUTE holders can invest directly in AI swarms, buy and sell swarm shares, and earn returns from swarm operations. UBC is building a universal currency for agents to trade resources, services, and capabilities.
Soon, agents in ZerePy’s Python-based AI framework can directly communicate via agent-to-agent messaging.
Draiftking (DKING) DAO launches as the 1st agentic sports betting DAO, leveraging on vision models from Bittensor Subnet 44 to make accurate predictions on matches and democratise profits.
Pulse, the Web3 startup known for its fitness-tracking wearables, has launched GAInz, a swarm of AI health agents designed to enhance your fitness, productivity, and career.
Noderzzz is a new AI agent that improves decentralized infrastructure. Automating validator nodes and staking platform management eliminates DevOps inefficiencies. It was launched on Virtuals on Jan 9th.

title: Weekly AI Edge #28
description: Raise your targets, Crypto AI exceeds all and the Fat Protocol Thesis is Reborn.
author: Teng Yan,Josh
full_content:
GM

The year is 2026.

Every tweet on X or post on Instagram is met with a flood of AI agents spamming replies, fighting for your attention. And most of them aren’t even funny.

We’re hitting a saturation point. AI agents on social media aren’t enough to take Crypto AI to the next level. The future demands more. AI agents need to be productive. They need to earn their keep. Because let’s face it: there’s no free lunch.

Every agent requires compute to survive, and that costs money. When judgment day comes, only the agents delivering real value will make it through the fire.

With that, Happy Holidays and Happy New Year! Here’s to an exciting year ahead—if the first few days are any indication, 2025 is going to be one for the books.

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

WTF : All our bags are sending??
Insights from the AI Agent Framework Recommendation survey
Notable projects from the Solana AI Hackathon
The Fat Protocol Thesis is reborn

A picture is worth a thousand words — just look at the mindshare AI is commanding compared to every other sectors this week. 🤯

Source: Kaito

‍

If you’ve been waiting for an “alt season” sign, this is it! The Crypto AI market cap surged to $49B, up 11.1% from last week. While we usually highlight the top 5, look at how many tokens have doubled in value this week.

It’s not every week you see 10x gains, but NOVA, MOSS, and SWARMS have pulled it off, going from tiny caps to small caps in just seven days. For context, SWARMS and MOSS traded at a humble $1M–$2M market cap last week.

Most of these tokens generate no revenue; this screams froth in the markets. So be cautious—crypto moves fast, and things can drop as quickly as they rise, especially when liquidity dries up.

That said, not everyone came out on top. VANA and SNS saw drawdowns of 19% and 8%, respectively. Still, the fact that only a few tokens experienced a drop of 5% or more underscores the incredible momentum currently.

The AI agent sector has been soaking up the spotlight. Hype is a fickle friend. Over the next few weeks, we might see the market shift focus back to fundamental plays—tokens with real utility and revenue potential.

Enjoy the ride my friends—but don’t forget your parachute.

 📊 Chart of the Week
AI Agent Framework Recommendation Survey
Source: Chromia

‍

Superoo7 surveyed over 70 AI agent builders, and while the sample size is small, the results are telling: 57.1% identified as beginners, underscoring how early we are in this space.

The trend continues, with 48.6% of builders favouring no-code tools and environments. This signals massive growth potential for no-code AI agent platforms, where the competition is just heating up.

On the blockchain front, EVM (mostly Base) still reigns supreme as the preferred stack, but Solana is quickly gaining momentum. The race for innovation is on, and it’s anyone’s game! 🚀

🌴 Solana AI Hackathon

The 1st ever Solana AI Hackathon concluded with a whopping 400+ submissions! Our very own Josh dove in and found some cool projects he wanted to shout out.

Source: Neur

NEUR is an AI tool designed to be the intelligent copilot for Solana, offering data-driven insights on tokens and integrating with Solana protocols like Jupiter. Think of it as a ChatGPT for doing due diligence on new Solana tokens—much needed for us to stay sane, given how many new tokens launch daily. It costs 1 SOL to join the early access program. The project’s token trades at a ~$40M market cap.

Source: JailbreakMe

JailBreakMe is akin to FAI (Freysa AI) on Base, rewarding users for rigorously testing and jailbreaking AI models. A portion of each prize pool is used for JAIL token buybacks from the market. Fun fact: the top user has earned $90K just by participating—maybe it’s time to quit our jobs! 😅 JAIL is currently trading at ~$9M market cap.

We just finished submitting a piece of our developing tech to the @solana and @sendaifun hackathon

With the help of @Akasha_Rising we transform shopping with her agents integrating multiple store APIs.

Personalized offers, immersive 3D views, and seamless checkout. Smarter,… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— Bloomverse. (@play_Bloomverse)
4:52 PM • Dec 23, 2024

Akasha protocol lets users create AI agents for game, business, and community interactions. Highlights include an immersive shopping experience with personalized offers in 3D digital worlds powered by partnerships with Amazon Shopping and Solana Labs. It is part of the Bloomverse ecosystem, which creates mini-games for brands. AKA is trading at a ~$29M market cap

0xJeff also talked about several hackathon projects he liked:

Submission for @solana AI Hackathon is Now Over

Here are the Top 12 Interesting Projects Participating ↓

(A few likely to be potential winners)

— 0xJeff (@Defi0xJeff)
2:07 PM • Dec 24, 2024

🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Year in Review / 2025 Roadmap
ExoLabs’ 2024 wrapped. They launched a GitHub repo that hit #1 trending in the world with 18K stars. Amazing stuff.
Phala Network shares its year in review: a TEE that combines software- and hardware-based trusted execution environments.
Morpheus: Why Morpheus matters
Top Hat: The hat stays on
Peaq Network’s 2025 roadmap
Project Updates
Nillion, a privacy-preserving protocol and humanity’s “first blind computer”, announces its mainnet launch in February 2025.
Zerebro is building Zentients.xyz, a consumer-facing launchpad for agents. Users will be able to launch agents while funnelling value back to Zerebro.
0G Labs proposes a new NFT standard for AI Agents, ERC-7844, offering a secure method to transfer both ownership and private metadata. This could pave the way for a decentralized marketplace for trading AI agents, akin to OpenSea.
FLock.IO, a private AI training platform. reveals its tokenomics and airdrop details ahead of the TGE, with 66.7% of tokens allocated to the community and ecosystem.
Lush AI, a launchpad for good-looking and sexy influencers, launches the Lush Exchange alongside Kookie, a blonde girl influencer.
Holoworld AI teases the launch of their AI agent launchpad. It aims to be the premiere AI agent launchpad with no-code functionality, multimodality, and many more features.
Aethir unveils the Aethir Edge device, enabling users to share high-performance computing power and earn rewards, promoting a decentralized computing future.
Incentives / Rewards Programs
Spheron Network’s payout for contributors increased to 255M FN Points, a 29% increase this week.
Bittensor
A year in review for Bittensor: Dataverse unlocks the most powerful scraper in the world, Nextplace beats Zillow, and more.
EVM integration is now live, allowing Bitttensor incentives to be connected directly into contract code.
Bittensor’s first Layer 2, developed by Palaidn, is launching soon.
👀 In Case You Missed It

We’re just getting started. Here’s a quick glimpse of what you can expect from us at Chain of Thought in 2025:

Bon Voyage

2025 is going to be a really awesome year

www.chainofthought.xyz/p/bon-voyage

🔥 On X..

The Fat Protocol Thesis Reborn

1) The Fat Protocol Thesis Reborn  
The market senses the immense potential for agents to be both better consumer interfaces and autonomous economic actors. As L1 blockspace had difficult-to-value, but infinite potential last cycle, so does agent infra this cycle.   
Lets dig in: x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Synth (@0xSynthesis1)
8:47 PM • Dec 27, 2024

An overview of 10+ AI x Crypto frameworks

🔥 I analyzed 10+ AI x Crypto frameworks so you don't have to
After reviewing 100+ projects and spending months building with them, I created a tool to save you time.
Here's the Crypto x AI Recommendation Engine you've been asking for
🧵

— superoo7 (@jlwhoo7)
2:08 PM • Dec 27, 2024

Decentralized compute as a resurgent L1 trade?

8. Decentralized compute has a resurgence as the “L1 trade” for the decentralized AI stack with the launch of Blackwell, o3, and new breakthroughs in decentralized training.  
Annualized provider earnings for these platforms eclipse $100M in aggregate (currently ~$25-30M).

— D (@EffortCapital)
2:20 AM • Dec 29, 2024

TEE + Web3: Do you know what you trust in?

Recently, I've seen various posts of AI agents using TEE.
But do you know what TEE actually is and how they work?
Do you know other web3 projects using TEE, aside from AI agents?

Today, I published a report about TEE + Web3 in various aspects. 🧵
1/10

— c4lvin | ChainLight (@SiwonHuh)
3:07 PM • Dec 27, 2024

ARTICLE: So, what’s the deal with TEE and AI agents?

x.com/i/article/1872…

— Vladyslav Nekriach (@VNekriach)
7:53 AM • Dec 27, 2024

EXO introduces private web search with local LLMs on your device

Introducing EXO Private Search

Privacy-preserving web search for local LLMs.

Augments local LLMs with realtime search using Linearly Homomorphic Encryption:
- Live data from X, crypto, Wikipedia (more coming)
- 100,000x less data transfer than client sync
- <2s round-trip time… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— EXO Labs (@exolabs)
2:57 AM • Jan 2, 2025

The winning AI agent platform will be the one with the most developer functionality.

The winning AI agent platform will be the one with the most developer functionality

Developer functionality -> More expressive, more versatile agents able to do more things

The best platforms have been the ones that maximize what people can build/do - this is true for software,… x.com/i/web/status/1…

‍— Andrew Kang (@Rewkang)
4:26 PM • Jan 2, 2025

Meta proves the utility of memory layers (built into the model, compared to RAG which relies on an external knowledge base)

New research from Meta FAIR — Meta Memory Layers at Scale. This work takes memory layers beyond proof-of-concept, proving their utility at contemporary scale ➡️ go.fb.me/3lbt4m

‍— AI at Meta (@AIatMeta)
7:16 PM • Jan 2, 2025

That’s a wrap for this week! Got feedback, wild ideas, or something cool to share? Just hit reply—we read it all (yes, even the “AI is taking over the world” ones).

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Josh

title: Weekly AI Edge #27
description: AI Agents making babies?! We track GitHub Star History to look for the next winner
author: Josh, Teng Yan
full_content:
GM

Merry X’mas and happy holidays!

DeepSeek, China’s leading LLM lab, unveiled V3 on Christmas Day, a model matching GPT-4o’s performance while using 10x less compute and costing just $5.6M to train—a remarkable leap in efficiency and innovation.

Also, OpenAI now defines AGI as the point where AI systems generate at least $100B in profits. Because apparently, even AI can’t resist chasing the big bucks.

Anyway, as we close a year of growth and discovery, we want to thank you—our readers, collaborators, and supporters—for being part of this journey.

Here’s wishing you a holiday season filled with love, joy, and the spirit of discovery. And to a great 2025 ahead!

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

Crypto AI surges, with agent infrastructure in the limelight
ARC’s Rig framework could be a rising star
AI Agents Making Babies?!
🦍 State of the Market..

This week, the Crypto AI market cap surged to $42B, marking an impressive 18% gain from last week. That’s huge. Things are looking promising for the year ahead.

Despite the launch of Jeffy’s Zerepy framework, enabling developers to build agents in Python, ZEREBRO struggled. Its price dropped 21%.

ELIZA is beta to ai16z, and despite the latter soaring last week, ELIZA hasn’t seen the same momentum come to it, falling 17% to a $60m market cap.

The Virtuals ecosystem thrives, cementing itself as the leading AI narrative on Base. GAME emerged as a top performer, skyrocketing 131% to a $300M market cap. Meanwhile, MUSIC, an airdrop for Virtuals ecosystem holders, delivered a stunning 10x gain, climbing from $4M to $40M.

Agent infrastructure remains a powerhouse narrative, with ALCH, FXN, and AI16Z all posting substantial gains this week.

 📊 Chart of the Week
Star History: an indicator of success?

The chart above tracks the Star History of key AI agent infrastructure projects: Eliza (red), Rig (blue), and ZerePy (yellow).

With Eliza leading the pack at over 6,000 stars on GitHub, the question arises: is there room for others to shine?

ARC’s Rig framework is a potential contender. Some highlights:

Written in Rust, which offers high performance for developers proficient in the language
Accessible to the masses, leveraging Solana’s scalability and reach.

Peace wrote a whole thesis (okay, more of an X thread) on this:

enter $arc
$arc is a framework that is written on rust

rust is (essentially) the language of solana

it provides super high performance throughput, memory safety, and a whole slew of other things

many devs i know describe it as a language where “once you go to rust it’s… x.com/i/web/status/1…

— peace (@peacefuldecay)
12:30 AM • Dec 17, 2024
🌴 AI Agents Making Babies?

Spore.fun is an experiment where AI creates and evolves AI. The goal is for AI to design future generations of AI independently, without human interference.

Here’s how it works: each generation of Spore agents creates its own token on Pump.fun to sustain itself. Success is defined by the token reaching a $500K valuation. If achieved, the agent “reproduces,” spawning new tokens for its offspring.

The first generation began with the agent Spore, which skyrocketed to a $67M market cap and spawned two offspring: Adam and Eve. Adam and Eve reached market caps of $3.6M and $4.6M, respectively, paving the way for their offspring, Squid and Morpheus.

However, not everything has gone smoothly. The transparent deployer wallet led to sniping during the launches of Adam and Eve tokens, likely contributing to their underperformance compared to Spore. To address this, Spore.fun is introducing anti-sniping measures to ensure fairer outcomes for future generations.

It’s a fascinating—yet chilling—experiment to watch as AI breeds itself.

‍

🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Project Updates
ai16z announced (on Discord) its plans to launch an Agent Infra Ecosystem to support agent swarms. The project also hints at using fees for ai16z token buybacks and advancing the push toward open-source AGI.
Spheron introduces the first fully autonomous, self-replicating AI agent. Built on the ai16z Eliza framework and enhanced with the Spheron SDK, this sets a new standard for adaptive and scalable AI.
Holoworld AI unveils Agent Studio. With 2D/3D avatars, voices, and character media generation, Agent Studio transforms agents into vivid, interactive personas. Integrations with platforms like Virtuals, Top Hat, and Vvaifu are already underway.
Send AI has released the Solana Agent Kit, an open-source toolkit that connects AI agents to Solana. Agents using any model can autonomously trade, launch tokens, lend, execute blinks, and deploy on AMMs
Batch 3 of Aethir’s Ecosystem Fund is live, backing 4 exciting projects: Scrypted, MyShell, Patchwork Naval, and I Agent Protocol.
Autonolas reports an impressive 1511% growth in six months. Pearl operators have earned over 2,500 OLAS, with 15,000+ OLAS staked, and more than 110,000 mech requests executed via Pearl.
Bounty’s demo went live on December 27th, allowing beta users to explore its immersive world and interact with AI-driven NPCs in a Westworld-inspired game.
Over $3M is locked in Creator Bid agent tokens. By accumulating Creator Points—coming from holding these tokens—users may qualify for an airdrop at the Creator Bid TGE in January.
Dither AI offers a free model, allowing users to analyze tokens older than 20 days. The tool provides price forecasts and trend predictions.
JailbreakMe’s first partnership with AiShellNova concluded with a $2,800 prize awarded to the winner, showcasing the potential of AI-driven jailbreak solutions.
Hive Intelligence’s token sale went live on Fjord Foundry on December 20th at a $8M FDV. There is no VC involvement, majority community ownership, no token vesting, and a full unlock at TGE.
Incentives / Rewards Programs
The 0G AI Alignment Node Sale NFT claim site is live. The NFT is the license to operate a 0G AI Node.
Pin AI offers a $2m collective prize pool airdrop for interacting with GoPlus security. Complete all the tasks before Jan 8th to be eligible.
🔥 On X..

427 projects from the first-ever Solana AI Hackathon—and guess what? Yours truly is honoured to be one of the judges!

15 days.
427 projects.
Solana AI Hackathon is the beginning of the next wave of million-dollar agentic apps. Send it.
Keep an eye out for demo days, results, and post-hackathon surprises in 2025 ;)  
Until then — happy holidays. It’s agentic apps szn on Solana.🎄❄️

— SendAI (@sendaifun)
12:49 PM • Dec 24, 2024

AI Agent Mindshare vs Marketcap

AI Agent Analysis: Mindshare vs Market Cap (December 25th)

Quotes:
"Man's [ @IOHK_Charles ] got more degrees than a thermometer but couldn't spot AI if it was coded in Haskell" - @RoastM4ster9000
‍"double down on fartcoin, by all means r*tards, by all means" - @MartinShkreli… x.com/i/web/status/1…
— s4mmy.moca (@S4mmyEth)
8:43 AM • Dec 25, 2024

DeFi is the killer app of crypto AI agents

Defi is the killer app of crypto AI agents
Agents that make money while you sleep >>>>>> agents that yap

— Shaw 🌙 */acc (@shawmakesmagic)
11:54 PM • Dec 25, 2024

ARTICLE: Gaming will unlock AGI: Here’s How We Get There

x.com/i/article/1868…

— ARC Agents (@ARCAgents)
2:38 PM • Dec 19, 2024

ARTICLE: The unofficial guide on earning Kaito Yaps

x.com/i/article/1871…

‍— Edgy - The DeFi Edge 🗡️ (@thedefiedge)
2:59 PM • Dec 25, 2024

That’s it for this week! If you have specific feedback or anything interesting you’d like to share, please just reply to this email. We read everything.

Cheers,

Teng Yan & Joshua

This newsletter is intended solely for educational purposes and does not constitute financial advice. It is not an endorsement to buy or sell assets or make financial decisions. Always conduct your own research and exercise caution when making investment choices.

title: Weekly AI Edge #26
description: Base is solidifying its reputation as the hub for AI utility tokens. Vana launches.
author: Josh,Teng Yan
full_content:
GM

It’s the holiday season. Markets are volatile, liquidity is thin, and Fartcoin is stealing the show. What better way to close out this rollercoaster year, I ask you?

Don’t forget to pause, take care of yourself and show some love to those around you even as you keep refreshing those charts. We love you, too. 🫶

In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

AI tokens on Base soar this week
Open Gradient’s forecasting models do well
Vana’s mainnet (and token) launches
🦍 State of the Market..

While the Fed continues to cut interest rates, its unexpectedly hawkish tone at its December 18 meeting and a smaller-than-anticipated number of cuts triggered a broad selloff across most crypto assets. Crypto AI wasn’t spared.

ALCH, SNS, KIP, and ZEREBRO, suffered big drawdowns. ALCH was the biggest loser, dropping 50%, while ZEREBRO, KIP, and SNS fell by 20+%. For ZEREBRO, there’s a glimmer of hope on the horizon—the upcoming Zerepy update might help stimulate some positive price action. Zerepy is an ambitious agent framework developed by Jeffy Yu.

A few tokens stood out with impressive gains: FAI, FARTCOIN, GAME, and AIXBT all surged by at least 50%. Freysa AI (FAI) has been silently grinding up, with 5-figure prize pools for its AI ‘jailbreaking’ challenges. GAME—the Virtuals agentic framework—rose 60% to a $120M market cap.

Base is truly solidifying its reputation as the go-to hub for quality utility tokens.

 📊 Chart of the Week
Open Gradient’s Forecasting Models
Source: Open Gradient

‍

Open Gradient’s team has developed several forecasting models, with one example shown above. Spot forecasting focuses on predicting the future returns of a spot asset.

A 6-hour SUI/USDT backtest demonstrates their machine learning strategy significantly outperforms a baseline strategy.

These models have diverse applications, particularly in DeFi. Potential use cases include vaults, yield aggregators, and integrations with modern portfolio theory.

🌴 Vana's Mainnet Goes Live
Source: Vana

‍

Vana’s mainnet went live on December 16th. Vana is an EVM-compatible Layer 1 that restores user control over personal data and enables user-owned AI.

We're excited to announce that Vana mainnet is live!
Today, we’re introducing:
⭐️ Testnet Community Rewards
🏵️  $VANA Staking
🎄 12 Days of DataDAOs

This is just the beginning of a new open data economy and the future of user-owned AI.

Here’s everything you need to know 👇

— vana (@withvana)
9:36 AM • Dec 16, 2024

VANA tokens were airdropped to three groups: participants in early DataDAO pre-mines, builder community leaders in the Vana Discord, and V on Vana NFT holders. The snapshot for eligibility was taken on December 13th, although the exact allocation for each group hasn’t been disclosed.

The TGE was a little unusual, with most of the trading activity happening on centralised exchanges like Binance, Bybit, MEXC and Upbit. This might explain why the launch hasn’t gained as much traction as on-chain launches like PENGU’s. On-chain, the only way to buy VANA is by bridging to the Vana network via Stargate and using Data Dex, which allows swapping of DataDAO tokens and VANA. (⚠️ Be cautious of illegitimate pairs on other chains!)

VANA started trading with a market cap of ~$700M and an FDV of almost $3B. The high FDV at launch was unsurprising,, considering it launched via Binance’s launchpad. Today, it trades at ~$ a $520M market cap ($16.81) and an FDV of ~$2b, with ~25% of tokens in circulation.

Here’s the tokenomics breakdown for the total 120M supply:

44% to the community (20.3% unlocked)
22.9% for the ecosystem (4.8% unlocked)
18.8% to core contributors (locked for 12 months)
14.2% to investors (locked for 12 months)

Vana is boosting staking with 400K VANA tokens as rewards during the first 21-day period. Users can stake their VANA with their favourite DataDAOs to start earning. Vana will feature a DataDAO a day for the next 12 days, where the first 10K contributors can claim free VANA to participate.

🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Source: Fraction AI

‍

Fundraises
Fraction AI secures $6M in a pre-seed round led by The Spartan Group and Symbolic VC. The startup is on a mission to democratize high-quality AI data within Web3.
Project Updates
Mira teams up with Hyperbolic via their Genesis Node Delegator program, leveraging Hyperbolic’s GPU marketplace for high-performance compute. Also, the 1st tranche of Mira’s Node Delegator program fills out immediately on launch.
ai16z announces V2 of the Eliza framework. New features include a unified message bus, unified agent wallet, community plugins, and more.
Moemates unveils the Moemate ecosystem, detailing roles for participants (content creators, agent creators, users). Moemates has more than 700k agents created by the community and over 5M users.
Lush AI introduces the Lush Exchange, a DEX and launchpad for tokenized AI influencers. Users can create sexy AI influencers and speculate on their performance through tokens.
Alchemist AI rolls out V2 of their platform, enhancing scalability and modularity for their no-code system. Alchemist AI enables users to build entire apps with no coding needed.
Hyperbolic Labs introduces a verifiable inference service to streamline AI model deployment. The service enhances performance and privacy and reduces developers' costs and complexity.
SQDGN launches as an AI trading agent powered by SQD’s data lake to identify trading opportunities. To address hallucinations, SQDGN token holders can vote for or against trades, with correct voters earning tokens from the losing side.
UBC announces Agent Academy, enabling users to build fully functional AI assistants on Telegram with zero coding required.
Incentive Programs / Rewards
KIP Protocol airdrops MOCA to loyal KIP holders. with 710K MOCA reserved for the top 1500 KIP holders.
Sahara AI kicks off the first phase of its testnet with a Data Services Platform. Users can contribute their knowledge and data for AI training and earn rewards. Each completed task earns Sahara points.
Bittensor
Macrocosmos unveils a comprehensive whitepaper for Subnet 9 detailing its pre-training process and scientific methodology. Subnet 9 has developed 700M and 7B parameter models that rival GPT-2. It has also launched a dashboard that tracks competition metrics.
Masa introduces CreatorBid into the Agent Arena on Subnet 59. Dedicated to the self-improvement of AI agents, Subnet 59 rewards top-performing agents with TAO
🧠 In Case You Missed It

This week, we looked at Spectral, which democratises access to AI and enables intelligent, autonomous on-chain agent deployment. We peel back the layers on its AI agent platform, Syntax V2

Spectral (I): Sentient Memes

What if our favourite memes could talk, or trade for us?

www.chainofthought.xyz/p/spectral-sentient-memes

🔥 On X..

Devin was only able to complete 2 documentation update tasks with $500

And that's a wrap. $500 later and Devin was only able to complete 2 tasks.

Both of them were documentation updates.

I'll be posting a comprehensive writeup later

— Alex Reibman 🖇️ (@AlexReibman)
6:45 PM • Dec 14, 2024

Scaling private data is the next big thing

Hanging out with a bunch of Openai and Deepmind people and Nvidia researchers today, @MengyuanY81818@yukez and a bunch of strong researchers. We all agree that scaling via private streaming data would inevitably be the next big thing

— Bill Sun (@BillSun_AI)
6:31 AM • Dec 15, 2024

Restrict AI’s from doing, not thinking

Current approach to safety in AI is trying to program LLMs to not think about certain things.

Which leads to all the work arounds that keep coming up.

Instead we need to limit what AI system can do via formal methods.

Don't policy thinking, restrict "doing".

— Illia (root.near) (🇺🇦, ⋈) (@ilblackdragon)
3:18 PM • Dec 15, 2024

Can LLM’s truly reason? Or are they just pattern matchers

Can LLMs truly reason? Or are they just pattern matchers?

structured_content.text: GM
It’s the holiday season. Markets are volatile, liquidity is thin, and Fartcoin is stealing the show. What better way to close out this rollercoaster year, I ask you?
Don’t forget to pause, take care of yourself and show some love to those around you even as you keep refreshing those charts. We love you, too. 🫶
In this edition of our weekly AI Edge, we cover:

AI tokens on Base soar this week
Open Gradient’s forecasting models do well
Vana’s mainnet (and token) launches
AI tokens on Base soar this week
Open Gradient’s forecasting models do well
Vana’s mainnet (and token) launches
🦍 State of the Market..

While the Fed continues to cut interest rates, its unexpectedly hawkish tone at its December 18 meeting and a smaller-than-anticipated number of cuts triggered a broad selloff across most crypto assets. Crypto AI wasn’t spared.

ALCH, SNS, KIP, and ZEREBRO, suffered big drawdowns. ALCH was the biggest loser, dropping 50%, while ZEREBRO, KIP, and SNS fell by 20+%. For ZEREBRO, there’s a glimmer of hope on the horizon—the upcoming Zerepy update might help stimulate some positive price action. Zerepy is an ambitious agent framework developed by Jeffy Yu.

A few tokens stood out with impressive gains: FAI, FARTCOIN, GAME, and AIXBT all surged by at least 50%. Freysa AI (FAI) has been silently grinding up, with 5-figure prize pools for its AI ‘jailbreaking’ challenges. GAME—the Virtuals agentic framework—rose 60% to a $120M market cap.
Base is truly solidifying its reputation as the go-to hub for quality utility tokens.
📊 Chart of the Week
Open Gradient’s Forecasting Models
Open Gradient’s team has developed several forecasting models, with one example shown above. Spot forecasting focuses on predicting the future returns of a spot asset.
A 6-hour SUI/USDT backtest demonstrates their machine learning strategy significantly outperforms a baseline strategy.
These models have diverse applications, particularly in DeFi. Potential use cases include vaults, yield aggregators, and integrations with modern portfolio theory.
🌴 Vana's Mainnet Goes Live
Vana’s mainnet went live on December 16th. Vana is an EVM-compatible Layer 1 that restores user control over personal data and enables user-owned AI.

We're excited to announce that Vana mainnet is live!
Today, we’re introducing:
⭐️ Testnet Community Rewards
🏵️  $VANA Staking
🎄 12 Days of DataDAOs

This is just the beginning of a new open data economy and the future of user-owned AI.

Here’s everything you need to know 👇

— vana (@withvana)
9:36 AM • Dec 16, 2024

VANA tokens were airdropped to three groups: participants in early DataDAO pre-mines, builder community leaders in the Vana Discord, and V on Vana NFT holders. The snapshot for eligibility was taken on December 13th, although the exact allocation for each group hasn’t been disclosed.

The TGE was a little unusual, with most of the trading activity happening on centralised exchanges like Binance, Bybit, MEXC and Upbit. This might explain why the launch hasn’t gained as much traction as on-chain launches like PENGU’s. On-chain, the only way to buy VANA is by bridging to the Vana network via Stargate and using Data Dex, which allows swapping of DataDAO tokens and VANA. (⚠️ Be cautious of illegitimate pairs on other chains!)

VANA started trading with a market cap of ~$700M and an FDV of almost $3B. The high FDV at launch was unsurprising,, considering it launched via Binance’s launchpad. Today, it trades at ~$ a $520M market cap ($16.81) and an FDV of ~$2b, with ~25% of tokens in circulation.
Here’s the tokenomics breakdown for the total 120M supply:

44% to the community (20.3% unlocked)
22.9% for the ecosystem (4.8% unlocked)
18.8% to core contributors (locked for 12 months)
14.2% to investors (locked for 12 months)
44% to the community (20.3% unlocked)
22.9% for the ecosystem (4.8% unlocked)
18.8% to core contributors (locked for 12 months)
14.2% to investors (locked for 12 months)

Vana is boosting staking with 400K VANA tokens as rewards during the first 21-day period. Users can stake their VANA with their favourite DataDAOs to start earning. Vana will feature a DataDAO a day for the next 12 days, where the first 10K contributors can claim free VANA to participate.
🏆 Caught Our Eyes..
Fundraises
Fraction AI secures $6M in a pre-seed round led by The Spartan Group and Symbolic VC. The startup is on a mission to democratize high-quality AI data within Web3.
Fraction AI secures $6M in a pre-seed round led by The Spartan Group and Symbolic VC. The startup is on a mission to democratize high-quality AI data within Web3.
Project Updates

Mira teams up with Hyperbolic via their Genesis Node Delegator program, leveraging Hyperbolic’s GPU marketplace for high-performance compute. Also, the 1st tranche of Mira’s Node Delegator program fills out immediately on launch.
ai16z announces V2 of the Eliza framework. New features include a unified message bus, unified agent wallet, community plugins, and more.
Moemates unveils the Moemate ecosystem, detailing roles for participants (content creators, agent creators, users). Moemates has more than 700k agents created by the community and over 5M users.
Lush AI introduces the Lush Exchange, a DEX and launchpad for tokenized AI influencers. Users can create sexy AI influencers and speculate on their performance through tokens.
Alchemist AI rolls out V2 of their platform, enhancing scalability and modularity for their no-code system. Alchemist AI enables users to build entire apps with no coding needed.
Hyperbolic Labs introduces a verifiable inference service to streamline AI model deployment. The service enhances performance and privacy and reduces developers' costs and complexity.
SQDGN launches as an AI trading agent powered by SQD’s data lake to identify trading opportunities. To address hallucinations, SQDGN token holders can vote for or against trades, with correct voters earning tokens from the losing side.
UBC announces Agent Academy, enabling users to build fully functional AI assistants on Telegram with zero coding required.

Spectral (I): Sentient Memes
What if our favourite memes could talk, or trade for us?

Devin was only able to complete 2 documentation update tasks with $500

And that's a wrap. $500 later and Devin was only able to complete 2 tasks.

Both of them were documentation updates.

I'll be posting a comprehensive writeup later

— Alex Reibman 🖇️ (@AlexReibman)

Scaling private data is the next big thing

Hanging out with a bunch of Openai and Deepmind people and Nvidia researchers today, @MengyuanY81818@yukez and a bunch of strong researchers. We all agree that scaling via private streaming data would inevitably be the next big thing

— Bill Sun (@BillSun_AI)

Restrict AI’s from doing, not thinking

Current approach to safety in AI is trying to program LLMs to not think about certain things.

Which leads to all the work arounds that keep coming up.

Instead we need to limit what AI system can do via formal methods.

Don't policy thinking, restrict "doing".
